    • get_info
Spectrum Instrumentation GmbH
built with pdoc

spcm

A high-level, general purpose, object-oriented Python package to control Spectrum Instrumentation GmbH devices.

spcm can connect to digitizers, AWGs, StarHubs and Netboxes. The package contains classes for controlling specific cards and synchronization devices (StarHub) as well as for specific functionality, such as DDS and TimeStamps.

Classes

Hardware classes

Hardware classes are the interfaces to the actual devices. These hardware classes support context management, hence the opening of specific devices is handled as a file open, using the Python with-statement.

Name Parent Description
Device (none) general base class for connecting to Spectrum Instrumentation GmbH devices and an interface for other classes.
Card Device a class to control the low-level API interface of Spectrum Instrumentation cards.
Sync Device a class for controling StarHub devices.
CardStack ExitStack a class that handles the opening and closing of a combination of different cards either with or without a StarHub that synchronizes the cards.
Netbox CardStack a class that handles the opening and closing of a group of cards combined in a Netbox.

Diagram


classDiagram
  class Device
  class Card
  class Sync
  class `contextlib.ExitStack`
  class CardStack
  class Netbox

  Device <|-- Card
  Device <|-- Sync
  `contextlib.ExitStack` <|-- CardStack
  CardStack <|-- Netbox

Functionality classes

Functionality classes handle specific functionality that is available to the card, as well as specific add-on options. A functionality class is provided with a hardware class object to handle functionality on that card. Some classes, in addition, also support groups of cards and can be provided with objects of type CardStack.

Name Parent Description
CardFunctionality (none) interface class for additional card functionality
Channels (none) class for controlling the channels of a card or a stack of cards
Channel (none) class for controlling a single channel
Clock CardFunctionality class for setting up the clock engine of the card
Trigger CardFunctionality class for setting up the trigger engine of the card
MultiPurposeIOs CardFunctionality class for setting up the multi purpose i/o's of the card
MultiPurposeIO (none) class for handling a single multi purpose i/o line a list of these objects resides inside MultiPurposeIOs
DataTransfer CardFunctionality special class for handling data transfer functionality
Multi DataTransfer special class for handling multiple recording and replay mode functionality
Sequence DataTransfer special class for handling sequence mode functionality
TimeStamp DataTransfer special class for handling time stamped data
Boxcar Multi special class for handling boxcar averaging
BlockAverage Multi special class for handling block averaging functionality
PulseGenerators CardFunctionality class for handling the pulse generator functionality
PulseGenerator (none) class for handling a single pulse generator a list of these objects resides inside PulseGenerators
DDS CardFunctionality class for handling DDS functionality

Diagram


classDiagram
  class CardFunctionality
  <<interface>> CardFunctionality
  class Channels
  class Clock
  class Trigger
  class MultiPurposeIOs
  class DataTransfer
  class DDS
  class PulseGenerators
  class Multi
  class TimeStamp
  class Sequence
  class Boxcar
  class BlockAverage
  CardFunctionality <|-- Clock
  CardFunctionality <|-- Trigger
  CardFunctionality <|-- MultiPurposeIOs
  CardFunctionality <|-- DataTransfer
  CardFunctionality <|-- DDS
  CardFunctionality <|-- PulseGenerators
  DataTransfer <|-- Multi
  DataTransfer <|-- TimeStamp
  DataTransfer <|-- Sequence
  Multi <|-- Boxcar
  Multi <|-- BlockAverage
  Channels *-- Channel
  MultiPurposeIOs *-- MultiPurposeIO
  PulseGenerators *-- PulseGenerator

Exception classes

When an error in the driver occures, the user is notified with an exception that contains an error object. Timeouts are also handled through exceptions and have their own class.

Name Parent Description
SpcmException (none) the main class to control exceptions that are raised due to errors that are raised by the low-level driver.
SpcmTimeout SpcmException when an timeout of the device occurs a special exception is raised of type SpcmTimeout

Diagram


classDiagram
  class SpcmTimeout
  class SpcmException
  SpcmException <|-- SpcmTimeout

Error classes

Errors coming from the driver API, are stored in an error object and then raised as an exception. The error object contains all the information coming from the driver.

Name Parent Description
SpcmError (none) all the errors that are raised by the low-level driver are packed into objects of this class and handled through exceptions

Diagram


classDiagram
  class SpcmError

Notes

  • See the files regs.py and spcerr.py for an extensive list of all the register names and errors that are handled by the driver.
  • For more information, please have a look at our hardware specific user manuals.

See also

  • Spectrum Instrumentation GmbH
  • GitHub
  • PyPI
  • Examples
  • Reference API

Supported devices

The following product families are supported:

  • Digitizers
    • M2p
      • 59xx-series
    • M4i / M4x
      • 22xx-series
      • 44xx-series
    • M5i
      • 33xx-series
    • digitizerNetbox
  • Arbitrary Waveform Generators (AWGs)
    • M2p
      • 65xx-series
    • M4i / M4x
      • 66xx-series
    • generatorNetbox
  • Digital Waveform Acquisition/Pattern Generation
    • M2p
      • 75xx-series
    • M4i / M4x
      • 77xx-series
  • Hybrid
    • hybridNetbox
 1"""
 2.. include:: ./README.md
 3
 4.. include:: ./SUPPORTED_DEVICES.md
 5"""
 6
 7# Import all registery entries and spectrum card errors into the module's name space
 8from .constants import *
 9
10# Import all the public classes into the module's namespace
11from .classes_device import Device
12from .classes_card import Card
13from .classes_error_exception import SpcmError, SpcmException, SpcmTimeout
14from .classes_sync import Sync
15from .classes_card_stack import CardStack
16from .classes_netbox import Netbox
17# Functionality
18from .classes_functionality import CardFunctionality
19from .classes_channels import Channels, Channel
20from .classes_clock import Clock
21from .classes_trigger import Trigger
22from .classes_multi_purpose_ios import MultiPurposeIO, MultiPurposeIOs
23from .classes_data_transfer import DataTransfer
24from .classes_multi import Multi
25from .classes_time_stamp import TimeStamp
26from .classes_sequence import Sequence
27from .classes_dds import DDS
28from .classes_pulse_generators import PulseGenerator, PulseGenerators
29from .classes_block_average import BlockAverage
30from .classes_boxcar import Boxcar
31
32__all__ = [
33    "Device", "Card", "Sync", "CardStack", "Netbox", "CardFunctionality", "Channels", "Channel", "Clock", "Trigger", "MultiPurposeIOs", "MultiPurposeIO",
34    "DataTransfer", "DDS", "PulseGenerator", "PulseGenerators", "Multi", "TimeStamp", "Sequence", "BlockAverage", "Boxcar",
35    "SpcmException", "SpcmTimeout", "SpcmError",
36]
37
38# Versioning support using versioneer
39from . import _version
40__version__ = _version.get_versions()['version']
41#print(__version__)
class Device: 
 20class Device():
 21    """
 22    a class to control the low-level API interface of Spectrum Instrumentation devices
 23
 24    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 25    for your specific device.
 26
 27    Parameters
 28    ----------
 29    device_identifier
 30        the identifying string that defines the used device
 31
 32    Raises
 33    ----------
 34    SpcmException
 35    SpcmTimeout
 36    """
 37
 38    # public
 39    device_identifier : str = ""
 40
 41    # private
 42    _kwargs : Dict[str, Union[int, float, str]] = {}
 43    _last_error = None
 44    _handle = None
 45    """the handle object used for the card connection"""
 46
 47    _str_len = 256
 48    _reraise : bool = False
 49    _throw_error : bool = True
 50    _verbose : bool = False
 51    _closed : bool = False
 52    """the indicator that indicated whether a connection is opened or closed is set to open (False)"""
 53
 54
 55    def __init__(self, device_identifier : str = "", handle = False, **kwargs) -> None:
 56        """Puts the device_identifier in the class parameter self.device_parameter
 57
 58        Parameters
 59        ----------
 60        device_identifier : str = ""
 61            an identifier string to connect to a specific device, for example:
 62
 63            * Local PCIe device '/dev/spcm0'
 64            * Remote 'TCPIP::192.168.1.10::inst0::INSTR'
 65        handle = False
 66            directly supply the object with an existing handle
 67        """
 68        self.device_identifier = device_identifier
 69        self._handle = handle
 70        self._kwargs = kwargs
 71        self._throw_error = kwargs.get("throw_error", True)
 72    
 73    def __del__(self) -> None:
 74        """Destructor that closes the connection associated with the handle"""
 75        if not self._closed:
 76            self.stop()
 77            self._closed = True
 78            self.close(self._handle)
 79
 80    def __enter__(self) -> object:
 81        """
 82        Constructs a handle using the parameter `device_identifier`, when using the with statement
 83        
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        object
 87            The active card handle
 88        
 89        Raises
 90        ------
 91        SpcmException
 92        """
 93
 94        if self.device_identifier and not self._handle:
 95            self.open(self.device_identifier)
 96            if not self._handle and self._throw_error:
 97                error = SpcmError(text="{} not found...".format(self.device_identifier))
 98                raise SpcmException(error)
 99        return self
100    
101    def __exit__(self, exception : SpcmException, error_value : str, trace : types.TracebackType) -> None:
102        """
103        Handles the exiting of the with statement, when either no code is left or an exception is thrown before
104
105        Parameters
106        ----------
107        exception : SpcmException
108            Only this parameter is used and printed 
109        error_value : str
110        trace : types.TracebackType
111
112        Raises
113        ------
114        SpcmException
115        """
116        if self._verbose and exception:
117            self._print("Error type: {}".format(exception))
118            self._print("Error value: {}".format(error_value))
119            self._print("Traceback:")
120            traceback.print_tb(trace)
121        elif exception:
122            self._print("Error: {}".format(error_value))
123        self.stop(M2CMD_DATA_STOPDMA) # stop the card and the DMA transfer
124        self._closed = True
125        self.close(self._handle)
126        if exception and self._reraise:
127            raise exception
128    
129    def handle(self) -> object:
130        """
131        Returns the handle used by the object to connect to the active card
132    
133        Class Parameters
134        ----------
135        self._handle
136    
137        Returns
138        -------
139        drv_handle
140            The active card handle
141        """
142        
143        return self._handle
144
145    # Check if a card was found
146    def __bool__(self) -> bool:
147        """
148        Check for a connection to the active card
149    
150        Class Parameters
151        ----------
152        self._handle
153    
154        Returns
155        -------
156        bool
157            True for an active connection and false otherwise
158            
159        Examples
160        -----------
161        >>> card = spcm.Card('/dev/spcm0')
162        >>> print(bool(card))
163        <<< True # if a card was found at '/dev/spcm0'
164        """
165        
166        return bool(self._handle)
167    
168    # High-level parameter functions, that use the low-level get and set function    
169    def drv_type(self) -> int:
170        """
171        Get the driver type of the currently used driver (see register `SPC_GETDRVTYPE` in the manual)
172    
173        Returns
174        -------
175        int
176            The driver type of the currently used driver
177        """
178
179        return self.get_i(SPC_GETDRVTYPE)
180
181    def drv_version(self) -> dict:
182        """
183        Get the version of the currently used driver. (see register `SPC_GETDRVVERSION` in the manual)
184    
185        Returns
186        -------
187        dict
188            version of the currently used driver
189              * "major" - the major version number,
190              * "minor" - the minor version number,
191              * "build" - the actual build
192        """
193        version_hex = self.get_i(SPC_GETDRVVERSION)
194        major = (version_hex & 0xFF000000) >> 24
195        minor = (version_hex & 0x00FF0000) >> 16
196        build = version_hex & 0x0000FFFF
197        version_dict = {"major": major, "minor": minor, "build": build}
198        return version_dict
199    
200    def kernel_version(self) -> dict:
201        """
202        Get the version of the currently used kernel. (see register `SPC_GETKERNELVERSION` in the manual)
203    
204        Returns
205        -------
206        dict 
207            version of the currently used driver
208              * "major" - the major version number,
209              * "minor" - the minor version number,
210              * "build" - the actual build
211        """
212        version_hex = self.get_i(SPC_GETKERNELVERSION)
213        major = (version_hex & 0xFF000000) >> 24
214        minor = (version_hex & 0x00FF0000) >> 16
215        build = version_hex & 0x0000FFFF
216        version_dict = {"major": major, "minor": minor, "build": build}
217        return version_dict
218    
219    def custom_modifications(self) -> dict:
220        """
221        Get the custom modifications of the currently used device. (see register `SPCM_CUSTOMMOD` in the manual)
222    
223        Returns
224        -------
225        dict
226            The custom modifications of the currently used device
227              * "starhub" - custom modifications to the starhub,
228              * "module" -  custom modification of the front-end module(s)
229              * "base" - custom modification of the base card
230        """
231
232        custom_mode = self.get_i(SPCM_CUSTOMMOD)
233        starhub = (custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_STARHUB_MASK) >> 16
234        module = (custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_MODULE_MASK) >> 8
235        base = custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_BASE_MASK
236        custom_dict = {"starhub": starhub, "module": module, "base": base}
237        return custom_dict
238
239    def cmd(self, *args) -> None:
240        """
241        Execute spcm commands (see register `SPC_M2CMD` in the manual)
242    
243        Parameters
244        ----------
245        *args : int
246            The different command flags to be executed.
247        """
248
249        cmd = 0
250        for arg in args:
251            cmd |= arg
252        self.set_i(SPC_M2CMD, cmd)
253    
254    def timeout(self, timeout : int = None) -> int:
255        """
256        Sets the timeout in ms (see register `SPC_TIMEOUT` in the manual)
257        
258        Parameters
259        ----------
260        timeout : int
261            The timeout in ms
262        
263        Returns
264        -------
265        int
266            returns the current timeout in ms
267        """
268
269        if timeout is not None:
270            self.set_i(SPC_TIMEOUT, timeout)
271        return self.get_i(SPC_TIMEOUT)
272    
273    def start(self, *args) -> None:
274        """
275        Starts the connected card and enables triggering on the card (see command `M2CMD_CARD_START` in the manual)
276
277        Parameters
278        ----------
279        *args : int
280            flags that are send together with the start command
281        """
282
283        self.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_START, *args)
284    
285    def stop(self, *args : int) -> None:
286        """
287        Stops the connected card (see command `M2CMD_CARD_STOP` in the manual)
288
289        Parameters
290        ----------
291        *args : int
292            flags that are send together with the stop command (e.g. M2CMD_DATA_STOPDMA)
293        """
294
295        self.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_STOP, *args)
296    
297    def reset(self) -> None:
298        """
299        Resets the connected device (see command `M2CMD_CARD_RESET` in the manual)
300        """
301
302        self.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_RESET)
303
304    def write_setup(self, *args) -> None:
305        """
306        Writes of the configuration registers previously changed to the device (see command `M2CMD_CARD_WRITESETUP` in the manual)
307
308        Parameters
309        ----------
310        *args : int
311            flags that are set with the write command
312        """
313
314        self.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_WRITESETUP, *args)
315    
316    def register_list(self, register_list : List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]) -> None:
317        """
318        Writes a list with dictionaries, where each dictionary corresponds to a command (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
319    
320        Parameters
321        ----------
322        register_list : List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]
323            The list of commands that needs to written to the specific registers of the card.
324        """
325
326        c_astParams = (ST_LIST_PARAM * 1024)()
327        astParams = ctypes.cast(c_astParams, ctypes.POINTER(ST_LIST_PARAM))
328        for i, register in enumerate(register_list):
329            astParams[i].lReg = register["lReg"]
330            astParams[i].lType = register["lType"]
331            if register["lType"] == TYPE_INT64:
332                astParams[i].Value.llValue = register["llValue"]
333            elif register["lType"] == TYPE_DOUBLE:
334                astParams[i].Value.dValue = register["dValue"]
335        self.set_ptr(SPC_REGISTER_LIST, astParams, len(register_list) * ctypes.sizeof(ST_LIST_PARAM))
336
337    # Low-level get and set functions
338    def get_i(self, register : int) -> int:
339        """
340        Get the integer value of a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
341    
342        Parameters
343        ----------
344        register : int
345            The specific register that will be read from.
346        
347        Returns
348        -------
349        int
350            The value as stored in the specific register
351        """
352
353        self._check_closed()
354        return_value = int64(0)
355        dwErr = spcm_dwGetParam_i64(self._handle, register, byref(return_value))
356        self._check_error(dwErr)
357        return return_value.value
358    get = get_i
359    """Alias of get_i"""
360    
361    def get_d(self, register : int) -> float:
362        """
363        Get the float value of a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
364    
365        Parameters
366        ----------
367        register : int
368            The specific register that will be read from.
369        
370        Returns
371        -------
372        float
373            The value as stored in the specific register
374        """
375
376        self._check_closed()
377        return_value = c_double(0)
378        self._check_error(spcm_dwGetParam_d64(self._handle, register, byref(return_value)))
379        return return_value.value
380    
381    def get_str(self, register : int) -> str:
382        """
383        Get the string value of a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
384    
385        Parameters
386        ----------
387        register : int
388            The specific register that will be read from.
389        
390        Returns
391        -------
392        str
393            The value as stored in the specific register
394        """
395
396        self._check_closed()
397        return_value = create_string_buffer(self._str_len)
398        self._check_error(spcm_dwGetParam_ptr(self._handle, register, byref(return_value), self._str_len))
399        return return_value.value.decode('utf-8')
400    
401    def set_i(self, register : int, value : int) -> None:
402        """
403        Write the value of a specific register to the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
404    
405        Parameters
406        ----------
407        register : int
408            The specific register that will be written.
409        value : int
410            The value that is written to the card.
411        """
412
413        self._check_error(spcm_dwSetParam_i64(self._handle, register, value))
414    
415    def set_d(self, register : int, value : float) -> None:
416        """
417        Write the value of a specific register to the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
418    
419        Parameters
420        ----------
421        register : int
422            The specific register that will be written.
423        value : float
424            The value that is written to the card.
425        """
426
427        self._check_error(spcm_dwSetParam_d64(self._handle, register, value))
428    
429    def set_ptr(self, register : int, reference : c_void_p, size : int) -> None:
430        """
431        Use a memory segment to write to a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
432    
433        Parameters
434        ----------
435        register : int
436            The specific register that will be read from.
437        reference : c_void_p
438            pointer to the memory segment
439        size : int
440            size of the memory segment
441        
442        Returns
443        -------
444        int
445            The value as stored in the specific register
446        """
447
448        self._check_closed()
449        self._check_error(spcm_dwSetParam_ptr(self._handle, register, reference, size))
450
451    # Error handling and exception raising
452    def _check_error(self, dwErr : int):
453        """
454        Create an SpcmError object and check for the last error (see the appendix in the user manual of your device for all the possible error codes)
455    
456        Parameters
457        ----------
458        dwErr : int
459            The error value as returned from a direct driver call
460        
461        Raises
462        ------
463        SpcmException
464        SpcmTimeout
465        """
466
467        # pass
468        if dwErr not in [ERR_OK, ERR_TIMEOUT] and self._throw_error:
469            self.get_error_info()
470            raise SpcmException(self._last_error)
471        elif dwErr == ERR_TIMEOUT:
472            raise SpcmTimeout("A card timeout occured")
473
474    def get_error_info(self) -> SpcmError:
475        """
476        Create an SpcmError object and store it in an object parameter
477    
478        Returns
479        ----------
480        SpcmError
481            the Error object containing the last error
482        """
483
484        self._last_error = SpcmError(self._handle)
485        return self._last_error
486    
487    def _check_closed(self) -> None:
488        """
489        Check if a connection to the card exists and if not throw an error
490
491        Raises
492        ------
493        SpcmException
494        """
495        if self._closed:
496            error_text = "The connection to the card has been closed. Please reopen the connection before sending commands."
497            if self._throw_error:
498                raise SpcmException(text=error_text)
499            else:
500                self._print(error_text)
501    
502    def _print(self, text : str, **kwargs) -> None:
503        """
504        Print information
505    
506        """
507
508        if self._verbose:
509            print(text, **kwargs)
510
511    def open(self, device_identifier : str) -> None:
512        """
513        Open a connection to the card and return the handle (see the user manual of your specific device on how to find out the device_identifier string)
514    
515        Parameters
516        ----------
517        device_identifier : str
518            The card identifier string (e.g. '/dev/spcm0' for a local device or 'TCPIP::192.168.1.10::inst0::INSTR' for a remote device)
519        """
520
521        self._handle = spcm_hOpen(create_string_buffer(bytes(device_identifier, 'utf-8')))
522        self._closed = False
523    
524    @staticmethod
525    def close(handle) -> None:
526        """
527        Close a connection to the card using a handle
528    
529        Parameters
530        ----------
531        handle
532            the handle object used for the card connection that is closed
533        """
534
535        spcm_vClose(handle)

a class to control the low-level API interface of Spectrum Instrumentation devices

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific device.

Parameters
  • device_identifier: the identifying string that defines the used device
Raises
  • SpcmException
  • SpcmTimeout
Device(device_identifier: str = '', handle=False, **kwargs) 
55    def __init__(self, device_identifier : str = "", handle = False, **kwargs) -> None:
56        """Puts the device_identifier in the class parameter self.device_parameter
57
58        Parameters
59        ----------
60        device_identifier : str = ""
61            an identifier string to connect to a specific device, for example:
62
63            * Local PCIe device '/dev/spcm0'
64            * Remote 'TCPIP::192.168.1.10::inst0::INSTR'
65        handle = False
66            directly supply the object with an existing handle
67        """
68        self.device_identifier = device_identifier
69        self._handle = handle
70        self._kwargs = kwargs
71        self._throw_error = kwargs.get("throw_error", True)

Puts the device_identifier in the class parameter self.device_parameter

Parameters

  • device_identifier (str = ""): an identifier string to connect to a specific device, for example:

    • Local PCIe device '/dev/spcm0'
    • Remote 'TCPIP::192.168.1.10::inst0::INSTR'
  • handle = False: directly supply the object with an existing handle
device_identifier: str = ''

def drv_type(self) -> int:

170        """

172    
173        Returns
174        -------
175        int
176            The driver type of the currently used driver
177        """
178

def drv_version(self) -> dict: 
181    def drv_version(self) -> dict:
182        """
183        Get the version of the currently used driver. (see register `SPC_GETDRVVERSION` in the manual)
184    
185        Returns
186        -------
187        dict
188            version of the currently used driver
189              * "major" - the major version number,
190              * "minor" - the minor version number,
191              * "build" - the actual build
192        """
193        version_hex = self.get_i(SPC_GETDRVVERSION)
194        major = (version_hex & 0xFF000000) >> 24
195        minor = (version_hex & 0x00FF0000) >> 16
196        build = version_hex & 0x0000FFFF
197        version_dict = {"major": major, "minor": minor, "build": build}
198        return version_dict

Get the version of the currently used driver. (see register SPC_GETDRVVERSION in the manual)

Returns
  • dict: version of the currently used driver
    • "major" - the major version number,
    • "minor" - the minor version number,
    • "build" - the actual build
def kernel_version(self) -> dict: 
200    def kernel_version(self) -> dict:
201        """
202        Get the version of the currently used kernel. (see register `SPC_GETKERNELVERSION` in the manual)
203    
204        Returns
205        -------
206        dict 
207            version of the currently used driver
208              * "major" - the major version number,
209              * "minor" - the minor version number,
210              * "build" - the actual build
211        """
212        version_hex = self.get_i(SPC_GETKERNELVERSION)
213        major = (version_hex & 0xFF000000) >> 24
214        minor = (version_hex & 0x00FF0000) >> 16
215        build = version_hex & 0x0000FFFF
216        version_dict = {"major": major, "minor": minor, "build": build}
217        return version_dict

Get the version of the currently used kernel. (see register SPC_GETKERNELVERSION in the manual)

Returns
  • dict: version of the currently used driver
    • "major" - the major version number,
    • "minor" - the minor version number,
    • "build" - the actual build
def custom_modifications(self) -> dict: 
219    def custom_modifications(self) -> dict:
220        """
221        Get the custom modifications of the currently used device. (see register `SPCM_CUSTOMMOD` in the manual)
222    
223        Returns
224        -------
225        dict
226            The custom modifications of the currently used device
227              * "starhub" - custom modifications to the starhub,
228              * "module" -  custom modification of the front-end module(s)
229              * "base" - custom modification of the base card
230        """
231
232        custom_mode = self.get_i(SPCM_CUSTOMMOD)
233        starhub = (custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_STARHUB_MASK) >> 16
234        module = (custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_MODULE_MASK) >> 8
235        base = custom_mode & SPCM_CUSTOMMOD_BASE_MASK
236        custom_dict = {"starhub": starhub, "module": module, "base": base}
237        return custom_dict

Get the custom modifications of the currently used device. (see register SPCM_CUSTOMMOD in the manual)

Returns
  • dict: The custom modifications of the currently used device
    • "starhub" - custom modifications to the starhub,
    • "module" - custom modification of the front-end module(s)
    • "base" - custom modification of the base card
def cmd(self, *args) -> None: 
239    def cmd(self, *args) -> None:
240        """
241        Execute spcm commands (see register `SPC_M2CMD` in the manual)
242    
243        Parameters
244        ----------
245        *args : int
246            The different command flags to be executed.
247        """
248
249        cmd = 0
250        for arg in args:
251            cmd |= arg
252        self.set_i(SPC_M2CMD, cmd)

Execute spcm commands (see register SPC_M2CMD in the manual)

Parameters
  • *args (int): The different command flags to be executed.
def timeout(self, timeout: int = None) -> int: 
254    def timeout(self, timeout : int = None) -> int:
255        """
256        Sets the timeout in ms (see register `SPC_TIMEOUT` in the manual)
257        
258        Parameters
259        ----------
260        timeout : int
261            The timeout in ms
262        
263        Returns
264        -------
265        int
266            returns the current timeout in ms
267        """
268
269        if timeout is not None:
270            self.set_i(SPC_TIMEOUT, timeout)
271        return self.get_i(SPC_TIMEOUT)

Sets the timeout in ms (see register SPC_TIMEOUT in the manual)

  • timeout (int): The timeout in ms

  • int: returns the current timeout in ms

def write_setup(self, *args) -> None:

def register_list(self, register_list: List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]) -> None: 
316    def register_list(self, register_list : List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]) -> None:
317        """
318        Writes a list with dictionaries, where each dictionary corresponds to a command (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
319    
320        Parameters
321        ----------
322        register_list : List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]
323            The list of commands that needs to written to the specific registers of the card.
324        """
325
326        c_astParams = (ST_LIST_PARAM * 1024)()
327        astParams = ctypes.cast(c_astParams, ctypes.POINTER(ST_LIST_PARAM))
328        for i, register in enumerate(register_list):
329            astParams[i].lReg = register["lReg"]
330            astParams[i].lType = register["lType"]
331            if register["lType"] == TYPE_INT64:
332                astParams[i].Value.llValue = register["llValue"]
333            elif register["lType"] == TYPE_DOUBLE:
334                astParams[i].Value.dValue = register["dValue"]
335        self.set_ptr(SPC_REGISTER_LIST, astParams, len(register_list) * ctypes.sizeof(ST_LIST_PARAM))

Writes a list with dictionaries, where each dictionary corresponds to a command (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)

Parameters
  • register_list (List[dict[str, Union[int, float]]]): The list of commands that needs to written to the specific registers of the card.
def get_i(self, register: int) -> int: 
338    def get_i(self, register : int) -> int:
339        """
340        Get the integer value of a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)
341    
342        Parameters
343        ----------
344        register : int
345            The specific register that will be read from.
346        
347        Returns
348        -------
349        int

351        """
352

354        return_value = int64(0)
355        dwErr = spcm_dwGetParam_i64(self._handle, register, byref(return_value))
356        self._check_error(dwErr)
357        return return_value.value

Get the integer value of a specific register of the card (see the user manual of your device for all the available registers)

class Card(spcm.Device): 
 15class Card(Device):
 16    """
 17    a high-level class to control Spectrum Instrumentation cards
 18
 19    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 20    for your specific card.
 21
 22    """
 23    _std_device_identifier : str = "/dev/spcm{}"
 24    _max_cards : int = 64
 25    
 26    _function_type : int = 0
 27    _card_type : int = 0
 28
 29    def __enter__(self) -> 'Card':
 30        """
 31        Context manager entry function
 32
 33        Returns
 34        -------
 35        Card
 36            The card object
 37        
 38        Raises
 39        ------
 40        SpcmException
 41        """
 42        super().__enter__()
 43
 44        # keyword arguments
 45        card_type = self._kwargs.get("card_type", 0)
 46        serial_number = self._kwargs.get("serial_number", 0)
 47
 48        if self.device_identifier == "":
 49            # No device identifier was given, so we need to find the first card
 50            self._handle = self.find(card_type=card_type, serial_number=serial_number)
 51            if not self._handle:
 52                if card_type:
 53                    raise SpcmException(text="No card found of right type")
 54                elif serial_number:
 55                    raise SpcmException(text="No card found with serial number: {}".format(serial_number))
 56        elif self._handle:
 57            if card_type != 0 and self.function_type() != card_type:
 58                raise SpcmException(text="The card with the given device identifier is not the correct type")
 59            elif serial_number != 0 and self.sn() != serial_number:
 60                raise SpcmException(text="The card with the given device identifier does not have the correct serial number")
 61        
 62        # Check python, driver and kernel version
 63        if self._verbose:
 64            print("Python version: {} on {}".format (platform.python_version(), platform.system()))
 65            print("Driver version: {major}.{minor}.{build}".format(**self.drv_version()))
 66            print("Kernel version: {major}.{minor}.{build}".format(**self.kernel_version()))
 67            if self._handle:
 68                print("Found '{}': {} sn {:05d}".format(self.device_identifier, self.product_name(), self.sn()))
 69
 70        # Get the function type of the card
 71        self._function_type = self.get_i(SPC_FNCTYPE)
 72        self._card_type = self.get_i(SPC_PCITYP)
 73        self._features = self.get_i(SPC_PCIFEATURES)
 74        
 75        return self
 76    
 77    def find(self, card_type : int = 0, serial_number : int = 0) -> Union[bool, int]:
 78        """
 79        Find first card that is connected to the computer, with either the given card type or serial number
 80
 81        Parameters
 82        ----------
 83        card_type : int = 0
 84            The function type of the card that needs to be found
 85        serial_number : int = 0
 86            The serial number of the card that needs to be found
 87
 88        """
 89        for nr in range(self._max_cards):
 90            device_identifier = self._std_device_identifier.format(nr)
 91            handle = spcm_hOpen(ctypes.create_string_buffer(bytes(device_identifier, 'utf-8')))
 92            if handle:
 93                self.device_identifier = device_identifier
 94                return_value = ctypes.c_int64()
 95                spcm_dwGetParam_i64(handle, SPC_FNCTYPE, ctypes.byref(return_value))
 96                function_type = return_value.value
 97                spcm_dwGetParam_i64(handle, SPC_PCISERIALNO, ctypes.byref(return_value))
 98                sn = return_value.value
 99                if card_type != 0 and (card_type & function_type) == function_type:
100                    return handle
101                elif sn != 0 and sn == serial_number:
102                    return handle
103                elif serial_number == 0 and card_type == 0:
104                    return handle
105                spcm_vClose(handle)
106        return False
107
108                
109    # High-level parameter functions, that use the low-level get and set function
110    def status(self) -> int:
111        """
112        Get the status of the card (see register `SPC_M2STATUS` in the manual)
113    
114        Returns
115        -------
116        int
117            The status of the card
118        """
119
120        return self.get_i(SPC_M2STATUS)
121    
122    def card_type(self) -> int:
123        """
124        Get the card type of the card (see register `SPC_PCITYP` in the manual)
125    
126        Returns
127        -------
128        int
129            The card type of the card
130        """
131
132        return self._card_type
133    
134    def series(self) -> int:
135        """
136        Get the series of the card (see register `SPC_PCITYP` and `TYP_SERIESMASK` in the manual)
137    
138        Returns
139        -------
140        int
141            The series of the card
142        """
143
144        return self.card_type() & TYP_SERIESMASK
145
146    def function_type(self) -> int:
147        """
148        Gives information about what type of card it is. (see register `SPC_FNCTYPE` in the manual)
149    
150        Returns
151        -------
152        int
153            The function type of the card
154
155            * SPCM_TYPE_AI = 1h - Analog input card (analog acquisition; the M2i.4028 and M2i.4038 also return this value)
156            * SPCM_TYPE_AO = 2h - Analog output card (arbitrary waveform generators)
157            * SPCM_TYPE_DI = 4h - Digital input card (logic analyzer card)
158            * SPCM_TYPE_DO = 8h - Digital output card (pattern generators)
159            * SPCM_TYPE_DIO = 10h - Digital I/O (input/output) card, where the direction is software selectable.
160        """
161
162        return self._function_type
163
164    def features(self) -> int:
165        """
166        Get the features of the card (see register `SPC_PCIFEATURES` in the manual)
167    
168        Returns
169        -------
170        int
171            The features of the card
172        """
173
174        return self._features
175    
176    def starhub_card(self) -> bool:
177        """
178        Check if the card is a starhub card (see register `SPC_PCIFEATURES` in the manual)
179    
180        Returns
181        -------
182        bool
183            True if the card is the card that carriers a starhub, False otherwise
184        """
185
186        return bool(self._features & SPCM_FEAT_STARHUBXX_MASK)
187    
188    def num_modules(self) -> int:
189        """
190        Get the number of modules of the card (see register `SPC_MIINST_MODULES` in the manual)
191    
192        Returns
193        -------
194        int
195            The number of modules of the card
196        """
197
198        return self.get_i(SPC_MIINST_MODULES)
199
200    def channels_per_module(self) -> int:
201        """
202        Get the number of channels per module of the card (see register `SPC_MIINST_CHPERMODULE` in the manual)
203    
204        Returns
205        -------
206        int
207            The number of channels per module of the card
208        """
209
210        return self.get_i(SPC_MIINST_CHPERMODULE)
211    
212    def num_channels(self) -> int:
213        """
214        Get the number of channels of the card (= SPC_MIINST_MODULES * SPC_MIINST_CHPERMODULE)
215    
216        Returns
217        -------
218        int
219            The number of channels of the card
220        """
221
222        return self.num_modules() * self.channels_per_module()
223
224    def card_mode(self, card_mode : int = None) -> int:
225        """
226        Set the card mode of the connected card (see register `SPC_CARDMODE` in the manual)
227        
228        Parameters
229        ----------
230        card_mode : int
231            the mode that the card needs to operate in
232
233        Returns
234        -------
235        int
236            the mode that the card operates in
237        """
238        
239        if card_mode is not None:
240            self.set_i(SPC_CARDMODE, card_mode)
241        return self.get_i(SPC_CARDMODE)
242
243    def product_name(self) -> str:
244        """
245        Get the product name of the card (see register `SPC_PCITYP` in the manual)
246    
247        Returns
248        -------
249        str
250            The product name of the connected card (e.g. M4i.6631-x8)
251        """
252
253        return self.get_str(SPC_PCITYP)
254    
255    def sn(self) -> int:
256        """
257        Get the serial number of a product (see register `SPC_PCISERIALNO` in the manual)
258    
259        Returns
260        -------
261        int
262            The serial number of the connected card (e.g. 12345)
263        """
264
265        return self.get_i(SPC_PCISERIALNO)
266
267    def active_channels(self) -> int:
268        """
269        Get the number of channels of the card (see register `SPC_CHCOUNT` in the manual)
270    
271        Returns
272        -------
273        int
274            The number of channels of the card
275        """
276
277        return self.get_i(SPC_CHCOUNT)
278
279    def bits_per_sample(self) -> int:
280        """
281        Get the number of bits per sample of the card (see register `SPC_MIINST_BITSPERSAMPLE` in the manual)
282    
283        Returns
284        -------
285        int
286            The number of bits per sample of the card
287        """
288
289        return self.get_i(SPC_MIINST_BITSPERSAMPLE)
290    
291    def bytes_per_sample(self) -> int:
292        """
293        Get the number of bytes per sample
294
295        Returns
296        -------
297        int
298            number of bytes per sample
299        """
300        return self.get_i(SPC_MIINST_BYTESPERSAMPLE)
301    
302    def max_sample_value(self) -> int:
303        """
304        Get the maximum ADC value of the card (see register `SPC_MIINST_MAXADCVALUE` in the manual)
305    
306        Returns
307        -------
308        int
309            The maximum ADC value of the card
310        """
311
312        return self.get_i(SPC_MIINST_MAXADCVALUE)

a high-level class to control Spectrum Instrumentation cards

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card.

def find(self, card_type: int = 0, serial_number: int = 0) -> Union[bool, int]: 
 77    def find(self, card_type : int = 0, serial_number : int = 0) -> Union[bool, int]:
 78        """
 79        Find first card that is connected to the computer, with either the given card type or serial number
 80
 81        Parameters
 82        ----------
 83        card_type : int = 0
 84            The function type of the card that needs to be found
 85        serial_number : int = 0
 86            The serial number of the card that needs to be found
 87
 88        """
 89        for nr in range(self._max_cards):
 90            device_identifier = self._std_device_identifier.format(nr)
 91            handle = spcm_hOpen(ctypes.create_string_buffer(bytes(device_identifier, 'utf-8')))
 92            if handle:
 93                self.device_identifier = device_identifier
 94                return_value = ctypes.c_int64()
 95                spcm_dwGetParam_i64(handle, SPC_FNCTYPE, ctypes.byref(return_value))
 96                function_type = return_value.value
 97                spcm_dwGetParam_i64(handle, SPC_PCISERIALNO, ctypes.byref(return_value))
 98                sn = return_value.value
 99                if card_type != 0 and (card_type & function_type) == function_type:
100                    return handle
101                elif sn != 0 and sn == serial_number:
102                    return handle
103                elif serial_number == 0 and card_type == 0:
104                    return handle
105                spcm_vClose(handle)
106        return False

Find first card that is connected to the computer, with either the given card type or serial number

Parameters
  • card_type (int = 0): The function type of the card that needs to be found
  • serial_number (int = 0): The serial number of the card that needs to be found

def function_type(self) -> int: 
146    def function_type(self) -> int:
147        """
148        Gives information about what type of card it is. (see register `SPC_FNCTYPE` in the manual)
149    
150        Returns
151        -------
152        int
153            The function type of the card
154
155            * SPCM_TYPE_AI = 1h - Analog input card (analog acquisition; the M2i.4028 and M2i.4038 also return this value)
156            * SPCM_TYPE_AO = 2h - Analog output card (arbitrary waveform generators)
157            * SPCM_TYPE_DI = 4h - Digital input card (logic analyzer card)
158            * SPCM_TYPE_DO = 8h - Digital output card (pattern generators)

Gives information about what type of card it is. (see register SPC_FNCTYPE in the manual)

Returns

  • int: The function type of the card

    • SPCM_TYPE_AI = 1h - Analog input card (analog acquisition; the M2i.4028 and M2i.4038 also return this value)
    • SPCM_TYPE_AO = 2h - Analog output card (arbitrary waveform generators)
    • SPCM_TYPE_DI = 4h - Digital input card (logic analyzer card)
    • SPCM_TYPE_DO = 8h - Digital output card (pattern generators)
    • SPCM_TYPE_DIO = 10h - Digital I/O (input/output) card, where the direction is software selectable.

class Sync(spcm.Device): 
  8class Sync(Device):
  9    """a class to control Spectrum Instrumentation Starhub synchronization devices
 10
 11    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 12    for your specific Starhub.
 13    
 14    Exceptions
 15    ----------
 16    SpcmException
 17    SpcmTimeout
 18    """
 19
 20    def enable(self, enable : bool | int = None) -> int:
 21        """
 22        Enable or disable the Starthub (see register 'SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 23
 24        Parameters
 25        ----------
 26        enable : bool
 27            enable or disable the Starthub
 28        """
 29
 30        if enable is not None:
 31            enable_mask = 0
 32            if isinstance(enable, bool):
 33                num_cards = self.sync_count()
 34                enable_mask = ((1 << num_cards) - 1) if enable else 0
 35            elif isinstance(enable, int):
 36                enable_mask = enable
 37            else:
 38                raise ValueError("The enable parameter must be a boolean or an integer")
 39            self.set_i(SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK, enable_mask)
 40        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK)
 41    
 42    def num_connectors(self) -> int:
 43        """
 44        Number of connectors that the Star-Hub offers at max. (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_NUMCONNECTORS' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 45
 46        Returns
 47        -------
 48        int
 49            number of connectors on the StarHub
 50        """
 51
 52        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_READ_NUMCONNECTORS)
 53    
 54    def sync_count(self) -> int:
 55        """
 56        Number of cards that are connected to this Star-Hub (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_SYNCCOUNT' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 57
 58        Returns
 59        -------
 60        int
 61            number of synchronized cards
 62        """
 63
 64        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_READ_SYNCCOUNT)
 65    
 66    def card_index(self, index) -> int:
 67        """
 68        Index of the card that is connected to the Star-Hub at the given local index (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_CARDIDX0' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 69
 70        Parameters
 71        ----------
 72        index : int
 73            connector index
 74
 75        Returns
 76        -------
 77        int
 78            card index
 79        """
 80
 81        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_READ_CARDIDX0 + index)
 82    
 83    def cable_connection(self, index) -> int:
 84        """
 85        Returns the index of the cable connection that is used for the logical connection `index`. (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_CABLECON0' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 86        The cable connections can be seen printed on the PCB of the star-hub. Use these cable connection information in case 
 87        that there are hardware failures with the star-hub cabeling.
 88
 89        Parameters
 90        ----------
 91        index : int
 92            connector index
 93
 94        Returns
 95        -------
 96        int
 97            cable index
 98        """
 99
100        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_READ_CABLECON0 + index)

a class to control Spectrum Instrumentation Starhub synchronization devices

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific Starhub.

Exceptions

SpcmException SpcmTimeout

def enable(self, enable: bool | int = None) -> int: 
20    def enable(self, enable : bool | int = None) -> int:
21        """
22        Enable or disable the Starthub (see register 'SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
23
24        Parameters
25        ----------
26        enable : bool
27            enable or disable the Starthub
28        """
29
30        if enable is not None:
31            enable_mask = 0
32            if isinstance(enable, bool):
33                num_cards = self.sync_count()
34                enable_mask = ((1 << num_cards) - 1) if enable else 0
35            elif isinstance(enable, int):
36                enable_mask = enable
37            else:
38                raise ValueError("The enable parameter must be a boolean or an integer")
39            self.set_i(SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK, enable_mask)
40        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_ENABLEMASK)

50        """

def cable_connection(self, index) -> int: 
 83    def cable_connection(self, index) -> int:
 84        """
 85        Returns the index of the cable connection that is used for the logical connection `index`. (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_CABLECON0' in chapter `Star-Hub` in the manual)
 86        The cable connections can be seen printed on the PCB of the star-hub. Use these cable connection information in case 
 87        that there are hardware failures with the star-hub cabeling.
 88
 89        Parameters
 90        ----------
 91        index : int
 92            connector index
 93
 94        Returns
 95        -------
 96        int
 97            cable index
 98        """
 99
100        return self.get_i(SPC_SYNC_READ_CABLECON0 + index)

Returns the index of the cable connection that is used for the logical connection index. (see register 'SPC_SYNC_READ_CABLECON0' in chapter Star-Hub in the manual) The cable connections can be seen printed on the PCB of the star-hub. Use these cable connection information in case that there are hardware failures with the star-hub cabeling.

  • int: cable index
Inherited Members

handle
drv_type
drv_version
kernel_version
custom_modifications

timeout

write_setup

get_i

get_d

close
class CardStack(contextlib.ExitStack): 
 14class CardStack(ExitStack):
 15    """
 16    A context manager object for handling multiple Card objects with or without a Sync object
 17 
 18    Parameters
 19    ----------
 20    cards : list[Card]
 21        a list of card objects that is managed by the context manager
 22    sync : Sync
 23        an object for handling the synchronization of cards
 24    sync_card : Card
 25        a card object that is used for synchronization
 26    sync_id : int
 27        the index of the sync card in the list of cards
 28    is_synced : bool
 29        a boolean that indicates if the cards are synchronized
 30    """
 31
 32    cards : list[Card] = []
 33    sync : Sync = None
 34    sync_card : Card = None
 35    sync_id : int = -1
 36    is_synced : bool = False
 37
 38    def __init__(self, card_identifiers : list[str] = [], sync_identifier : str = "", find_sync_card : bool = False) -> None:
 39        """
 40        Initialize the CardStack object with a list of card identifiers and a sync identifier
 41
 42        Parameters
 43        ----------
 44        card_identifiers : list[str] = []
 45            a list of strings that represent the VISA strings of the cards
 46        sync_identifier : str = ""
 47            a string that represents the VISA string of the sync card
 48        find_sync : bool = False
 49            a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically
 50        """
 51
 52        super().__init__()
 53        # Handle card objects
 54        self.cards = [self.enter_context(Card(identifier)) for identifier in card_identifiers]
 55        if find_sync_card:
 56            for id, card in enumerate(self.cards):
 57                if card.starhub_card():
 58                    self.sync_card = card
 59                    self.sync_id = id
 60                    self.is_synced = True
 61                    break
 62        if sync_identifier and (not find_sync_card or self.is_synced):
 63            self.sync = self.enter_context(Sync(sync_identifier))
 64            self.is_synced = bool(self.sync)
 65    
 66    def __bool__(self) -> bool:
 67        """Checks if all defined cards are connected"""
 68        connected = True
 69        for card in self.cards:
 70            connected &= bool(card)
 71        return connected
 72    
 73    def synched(self):
 74        """Checks if the sync card is connected
 75        """
 76        return bool(self.is_synched)
 77    
 78    def start(self, *args) -> None:
 79        """
 80        Start all cards
 81
 82        Parameters
 83        ----------
 84        args : list
 85            a list of arguments that will be passed to the start method of the cards
 86        """
 87        
 88        if self.sync:
 89            self.sync.start(*args)
 90        else:
 91            for card in self.cards:
 92                card.start(*args)
 93    
 94    def stop(self, *args) -> None:
 95        """
 96        Stop all cards
 97
 98        Parameters
 99        ----------
100        args : list
101            a list of arguments that will be passed to the stop method of the cards
102        """
103        
104        if self.sync:
105            self.sync.stop(*args)
106        else:
107            for card in self.cards:
108                card.stop(*args)
109    
110    def reset(self, *args) -> None:
111        """
112        Reset all cards
113
114        Parameters
115        ----------
116        args : list
117            a list of arguments that will be passed to the reset method of the cards
118        """
119        
120        if self.sync:
121            self.sync.reset(*args)
122        else:
123            for card in self.cards:
124                card.reset(*args)
125    
126    def force_trigger(self, *args) -> None:
127        """
128        Force trigger on all cards
129
130        Parameters
131        ----------
132        args : list
133            a list of arguments that will be passed with the force trigger command for the cards
134        """
135        
136        if self.sync:
137            # TODO: the force trigger needs to be correctly implemented in the driver
138            # self.sync.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_FORCETRIGGER, *args)
139            self.cards[0].cmd(M2CMD_CARD_FORCETRIGGER, *args)
140        else:
141            for card in self.cards:
142                card.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_FORCETRIGGER, *args)
143
144    def sync_enable(self, enable : bool | int = True) -> int:
145        """
146        Enable synchronization on all cards
147
148        Parameters
149        ----------
150        enable : bool | int
151            a boolean or integer mask to enable or disable the synchronization of different channels
152        
153        Returns
154        -------
155        int
156            the mask of the enabled channels
157        
158        Raises
159        ------
160        ValueError
161            The enable parameter must be a boolean or an integer
162        SpcmException
163            No sync card avaliable to enable synchronization on the cards
164        """
165        
166        if self.sync:
167            return self.sync.enable(enable)
168        else:
169            raise SpcmException("No sync card avaliable to enable synchronization on the cards")
170    
171    
172    @staticmethod
173    def id_to_ip(device_identifier : str) -> str:
174        """
175        Returns the IP address of the Netbox using the device identifier
176
177        Parameters
178        ----------
179        device_identifier : str
180            The device identifier of the Netbox
181
182        Returns
183        -------
184        str
185            The IP address of the Netbox
186        """
187        ip = device_identifier
188        ip = ip[ip.find('::') + 2:]
189        ip = ip[:ip.find ('::')]
190        return ip
191    
192    @staticmethod
193    def discover(max_num_remote_cards : int = 50, max_visa_string_len : int = 256, max_idn_string_len : int = 256, timeout_ms : int = 5000) -> dict[list[str]]:
194        """
195        Do a discovery of the cards connected through a network
196
197        Parameters
198        ----------
199        max_num_remote_cards : int = 50
200            the maximum number of remote cards that can be discovered
201        max_visa_string_len : int = 256
202            the maximum length of the VISA string
203        max_idn_string_len : int = 256
204            the maximum length of the IDN string
205        timeout_ms : int = 5000
206            the timeout in milliseconds for the discovery process
207
208        Returns
209        -------
210        CardStack
211            a stack object with all the discovered cards
212        
213        Raises
214        ------
215        SpcmException
216            No Spectrum devices found
217        """
218
219        visa = (pyspcm.c_char_p * max_num_remote_cards)()
220        for i in range(max_num_remote_cards):
221            visa[i] = pyspcm.cast(pyspcm.create_string_buffer(max_visa_string_len), pyspcm.c_char_p)
222        pyspcm.spcm_dwDiscovery (visa, pyspcm.uint32(max_num_remote_cards), pyspcm.uint32(max_visa_string_len), pyspcm.uint32(timeout_ms))
223
224        # ----- check from which manufacturer the devices are -----
225        idn = (pyspcm.c_char_p * max_num_remote_cards)()
226        for i in range(max_num_remote_cards):
227            idn[i] = pyspcm.cast(pyspcm.create_string_buffer(max_idn_string_len), pyspcm.c_char_p)
228        pyspcm.spcm_dwSendIDNRequest (idn, pyspcm.uint32(max_num_remote_cards), pyspcm.uint32(max_idn_string_len))
229
230        # ----- store VISA strings for all discovered cards and open them afterwards -----
231        list_spectrum_devices = {}
232        for (id, visa) in zip(idn, visa):
233            if not id:
234                break
235
236            if id.decode('utf-8').startswith("Spectrum GmbH,"):
237                ip = __class__.id_to_ip(visa.decode("utf-8"))
238                if ip in list_spectrum_devices:
239                    list_spectrum_devices[ip].append(visa.decode("utf-8"))
240                else:
241                    list_spectrum_devices[ip] = [visa.decode("utf-8")]
242        
243        if not list_spectrum_devices:
244            raise SpcmException("No Spectrum devices found")
245        
246        return list_spectrum_devices

A context manager object for handling multiple Card objects with or without a Sync object

Parameters
  • cards (list[Card]): a list of card objects that is managed by the context manager
  • sync (Sync): an object for handling the synchronization of cards
  • sync_card (Card): a card object that is used for synchronization
  • sync_id (int): the index of the sync card in the list of cards
  • is_synced (bool): a boolean that indicates if the cards are synchronized
CardStack( card_identifiers: list[str] = [], sync_identifier: str = '', find_sync_card: bool = False) 
38    def __init__(self, card_identifiers : list[str] = [], sync_identifier : str = "", find_sync_card : bool = False) -> None:
39        """
40        Initialize the CardStack object with a list of card identifiers and a sync identifier
41
42        Parameters
43        ----------
44        card_identifiers : list[str] = []
45            a list of strings that represent the VISA strings of the cards
46        sync_identifier : str = ""
47            a string that represents the VISA string of the sync card
48        find_sync : bool = False
49            a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically
50        """
51
52        super().__init__()
53        # Handle card objects
54        self.cards = [self.enter_context(Card(identifier)) for identifier in card_identifiers]
55        if find_sync_card:
56            for id, card in enumerate(self.cards):
57                if card.starhub_card():
58                    self.sync_card = card
59                    self.sync_id = id
60                    self.is_synced = True
61                    break
62        if sync_identifier and (not find_sync_card or self.is_synced):
63            self.sync = self.enter_context(Sync(sync_identifier))
64            self.is_synced = bool(self.sync)

  • find_sync (bool = False): a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically

@staticmethod
def id_to_ip(device_identifier: str) -> str: 
172    @staticmethod
173    def id_to_ip(device_identifier : str) -> str:
174        """
175        Returns the IP address of the Netbox using the device identifier
176
177        Parameters
178        ----------
179        device_identifier : str
180            The device identifier of the Netbox
181
182        Returns
183        -------
184        str
185            The IP address of the Netbox
186        """
187        ip = device_identifier
188        ip = ip[ip.find('::') + 2:]
189        ip = ip[:ip.find ('::')]
190        return ip

@staticmethod
def discover( max_num_remote_cards: int = 50, max_visa_string_len: int = 256, max_idn_string_len: int = 256, timeout_ms: int = 5000) -> dict[list[str]]: 
192    @staticmethod
193    def discover(max_num_remote_cards : int = 50, max_visa_string_len : int = 256, max_idn_string_len : int = 256, timeout_ms : int = 5000) -> dict[list[str]]:
194        """
195        Do a discovery of the cards connected through a network
196
197        Parameters
198        ----------
199        max_num_remote_cards : int = 50
200            the maximum number of remote cards that can be discovered
201        max_visa_string_len : int = 256
202            the maximum length of the VISA string
203        max_idn_string_len : int = 256
204            the maximum length of the IDN string
205        timeout_ms : int = 5000
206            the timeout in milliseconds for the discovery process
207
208        Returns
209        -------
210        CardStack
211            a stack object with all the discovered cards
212        
213        Raises
214        ------
215        SpcmException
216            No Spectrum devices found
217        """
218
219        visa = (pyspcm.c_char_p * max_num_remote_cards)()
220        for i in range(max_num_remote_cards):
221            visa[i] = pyspcm.cast(pyspcm.create_string_buffer(max_visa_string_len), pyspcm.c_char_p)
222        pyspcm.spcm_dwDiscovery (visa, pyspcm.uint32(max_num_remote_cards), pyspcm.uint32(max_visa_string_len), pyspcm.uint32(timeout_ms))
223
224        # ----- check from which manufacturer the devices are -----
225        idn = (pyspcm.c_char_p * max_num_remote_cards)()
226        for i in range(max_num_remote_cards):
227            idn[i] = pyspcm.cast(pyspcm.create_string_buffer(max_idn_string_len), pyspcm.c_char_p)
228        pyspcm.spcm_dwSendIDNRequest (idn, pyspcm.uint32(max_num_remote_cards), pyspcm.uint32(max_idn_string_len))
229
230        # ----- store VISA strings for all discovered cards and open them afterwards -----
231        list_spectrum_devices = {}
232        for (id, visa) in zip(idn, visa):
233            if not id:
234                break
235
236            if id.decode('utf-8').startswith("Spectrum GmbH,"):
237                ip = __class__.id_to_ip(visa.decode("utf-8"))
238                if ip in list_spectrum_devices:
239                    list_spectrum_devices[ip].append(visa.decode("utf-8"))
240                else:
241                    list_spectrum_devices[ip] = [visa.decode("utf-8")]
242        
243        if not list_spectrum_devices:
244            raise SpcmException("No Spectrum devices found")
245        
246        return list_spectrum_devices

Do a discovery of the cards connected through a network

Parameters
  • max_num_remote_cards (int = 50): the maximum number of remote cards that can be discovered
  • max_visa_string_len (int = 256): the maximum length of the VISA string
  • max_idn_string_len (int = 256): the maximum length of the IDN string
  • timeout_ms (int = 5000): the timeout in milliseconds for the discovery process
Returns
  • CardStack: a stack object with all the discovered cards
Raises
  • SpcmException: No Spectrum devices found

class Netbox(spcm.CardStack): 
 11class Netbox(CardStack):
 12    """
 13    A hardware class that controls a Netbox device
 14 
 15    Parameters
 16    ----------
 17    netbox_card : Card
 18        a card object that is the main card in the Netbox
 19    netbox_number : int
 20        the index of the netbox card in the list of cards
 21    is_netbox : bool
 22        a boolean that indicates if the card is a Netbox
 23    
 24    """
 25    netbox_card : Card = None
 26    netbox_number : int = -1
 27    is_netbox : bool = False
 28
 29    def __init__(self, card_identifiers : list[str] = [], sync_identifier : str = "", find_sync : bool = False, **kwargs) -> None:
 30        """
 31        Initialize the Netbox object with a list of card identifiers and a sync identifier
 32
 33        Parameters
 34        ----------
 35        card_identifiers : list[str] = []
 36            a list of strings that represent the VISA strings of the cards
 37        sync_identifier : str = ""
 38            a string that represents the VISA string of the sync card
 39        find_sync : bool = False
 40            a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically
 41        """
 42
 43        super().__init__(card_identifiers, sync_identifier, find_sync, **kwargs)
 44
 45        for id, card in enumerate(self.cards):
 46            netbox_type = card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_TYPE)
 47            if netbox_type != 0:
 48                self.netbox_card = card
 49                self.netbox_number = id
 50                self.is_netbox = True
 51                break
 52
 53    def __bool__(self) -> bool:
 54        """
 55        Checks if the Netbox is connected and returns true if the connection is alive
 56
 57        Returns
 58        -------
 59        bool
 60            True if the Netbox is connected
 61        """
 62
 63        return self.is_netbox
 64        
 65    def type(self) -> dict[int, int, int, int]:
 66        """
 67        Returns the type of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_TYPE' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
 68
 69        Returns
 70        -------
 71        dict[int, int, int, int]
 72            A dictionary with the series, family, speed and number of channels of the Netbox
 73        """
 74
 75        netbox_type = self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_TYPE)
 76        netbox_series = (netbox_type & NETBOX_SERIES_MASK) >> 24
 77        netbox_family = (netbox_type & NETBOX_FAMILY_MASK) >> 16
 78        netbox_speed = (netbox_type & NETBOX_SPEED_MASK) >> 8
 79        netbox_channel = (netbox_type & NETBOX_CHANNEL_MASK)
 80        return {"series" : netbox_series, "family" : netbox_family, "speed" : netbox_speed, "channel" : netbox_channel}
 81
 82    def ip(self) -> str:
 83        """
 84        Returns the IP address of the Netbox using the device identifier of the netbox_card
 85
 86        Returns
 87        -------
 88        str
 89            The IP address of the Netbox
 90        """
 91        
 92        return self.id_to_ip(self.netbox_card.device_identifier)
 93
 94    def sn(self) -> int:
 95        """
 96        Returns the serial number of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_SERIALNO' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
 97
 98        Returns
 99        -------
100        int
101            The serial number of the Netbox
102        """
103
104        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_SERIALNO)
105    
106    def production_date(self) -> int:
107        """
108        Returns the production date of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_PRODUCTIONDATE' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
109
110        Returns
111        -------
112        int
113            The production date of the Netbox
114        """
115
116        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_PRODUCTIONDATE)
117    
118    def hw_version(self) -> int:
119        """
120        Returns the hardware version of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_HWVERSION' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
121
122        Returns
123        -------
124        int
125            The hardware version of the Netbox
126        """
127
128        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_HWVERSION)
129    
130    def sw_version(self) -> int:
131        """
132        Returns the software version of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_SWVERSION' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
133
134        Returns
135        -------
136        int
137            The software version of the Netbox
138        """
139
140        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_SWVERSION)
141
142    def features(self) -> int:
143        """
144        Returns the features of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_FEATURES' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
145
146        Returns
147        -------
148        int
149            The features of the Netbox
150        """
151        
152        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_FEATURES)
153    
154    def custom(self) -> int:
155        """
156        Returns the custom code of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_CUSTOM' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
157
158        Returns
159        -------
160        int
161            The custom of the Netbox
162        """
163        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_CUSTOM)
164
165    def wake_on_lan(self, mac : int):
166        """
167        Set the wake on lan for the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_WAKEONLAN' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
168
169        Parameters
170        ----------
171        mac : int
172            The mac addresse of the Netbox to wake on lan
173        """
174        self.netbox_card.set_i(SPC_NETBOX_WAKEONLAN, mac)
175
176    def mac_address(self) -> int:
177        """
178        Returns the mac address of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_MACADDRESS' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
179
180        Returns
181        -------
182        int
183            The mac address of the Netbox
184        """
185        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_MACADDRESS)
186    
187    def temperature(self) -> int:
188        """
189        Returns the temperature of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_TEMPERATURE' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
190
191        Returns
192        -------
193        int
194            The temperature of the Netbox
195        """
196        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_TEMPERATURE)
197    
198    def shutdown(self):
199        """
200        Shutdown the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_SHUTDOWN' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
201        """
202        self.netbox_card.set_i(SPC_NETBOX_SHUTDOWN, 0)
203
204    def restart(self):
205        """
206        Restart the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_RESTART' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
207        """
208        self.netbox_card.set_i(SPC_NETBOX_RESTART, 0)
209    
210    def fan_speed(self, id : int) -> int:
211        """
212        Returns the fan speed of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_FANSPEED' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
213
214        Returns
215        -------
216        int
217            The fan speed of the Netbox
218        """
219        return self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_FANSPEED0 + id)

A hardware class that controls a Netbox device

Parameters
  • netbox_card (Card): a card object that is the main card in the Netbox
  • netbox_number (int): the index of the netbox card in the list of cards
  • is_netbox (bool): a boolean that indicates if the card is a Netbox
Netbox( card_identifiers: list[str] = [], sync_identifier: str = '', find_sync: bool = False, **kwargs) 
29    def __init__(self, card_identifiers : list[str] = [], sync_identifier : str = "", find_sync : bool = False, **kwargs) -> None:
30        """
31        Initialize the Netbox object with a list of card identifiers and a sync identifier
32
33        Parameters
34        ----------
35        card_identifiers : list[str] = []
36            a list of strings that represent the VISA strings of the cards
37        sync_identifier : str = ""
38            a string that represents the VISA string of the sync card
39        find_sync : bool = False
40            a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically
41        """
42
43        super().__init__(card_identifiers, sync_identifier, find_sync, **kwargs)
44
45        for id, card in enumerate(self.cards):
46            netbox_type = card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_TYPE)
47            if netbox_type != 0:
48                self.netbox_card = card
49                self.netbox_number = id
50                self.is_netbox = True
51                break

Initialize the Netbox object with a list of card identifiers and a sync identifier

Parameters
  • card_identifiers (list[str] = []): a list of strings that represent the VISA strings of the cards
  • sync_identifier (str = ""): a string that represents the VISA string of the sync card
  • find_sync (bool = False): a boolean that indicates if the sync card should be found automatically
netbox_card: Card = None
netbox_number: int = -1
is_netbox: bool = False
def type(self) -> dict[int, int, int, int]: 
65    def type(self) -> dict[int, int, int, int]:
66        """
67        Returns the type of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_TYPE' in chapter `Netbox` in the manual)
68
69        Returns
70        -------
71        dict[int, int, int, int]
72            A dictionary with the series, family, speed and number of channels of the Netbox
73        """
74
75        netbox_type = self.netbox_card.get_i(SPC_NETBOX_TYPE)
76        netbox_series = (netbox_type & NETBOX_SERIES_MASK) >> 24
77        netbox_family = (netbox_type & NETBOX_FAMILY_MASK) >> 16
78        netbox_speed = (netbox_type & NETBOX_SPEED_MASK) >> 8
79        netbox_channel = (netbox_type & NETBOX_CHANNEL_MASK)
80        return {"series" : netbox_series, "family" : netbox_family, "speed" : netbox_speed, "channel" : netbox_channel}

Returns the type of the Netbox (see register 'SPC_NETBOX_TYPE' in chapter Netbox in the manual)

Returns
  • dict[int, int, int, int]: A dictionary with the series, family, speed and number of channels of the Netbox
def ip(self) -> str: 
82    def ip(self) -> str:
83        """
84        Returns the IP address of the Netbox using the device identifier of the netbox_card
85
86        Returns
87        -------
88        str
89            The IP address of the Netbox
90        """
91        
92        return self.id_to_ip(self.netbox_card.device_identifier)

Returns the IP address of the Netbox using the device identifier of the netbox_card

Returns
  • str: The IP address of the Netbox

 97

  • int: The serial number of the Netbox

def fan_speed(self, id: int) -> int:

class CardFunctionality: 
 6class CardFunctionality:
 7    """
 8    A prototype class for card specific functionality that needs it's own namespace
 9    """
10    card : Card
11    function_type = 0
12
13    def __init__(self, card : Card) -> None:
14        """
15        Takes a Card object that is used by the functionality
16
17        Parameters
18        ----------
19        card : Card
20            a Card object on which the functionality works
21        """
22        self.card = card
23        self.function_type = self.card.function_type()
24    
25    
26    # Check if a card was found
27    def __bool__(self) -> bool:
28        """
29        Check for a connection to the active card
30    
31        Returns
32        -------
33        bool
34            True for an active connection and false otherwise
35        
36        """
37        
38        return bool(self.card)

A prototype class for card specific functionality that needs it's own namespace

CardFunctionality(card: Card) 
13    def __init__(self, card : Card) -> None:
14        """
15        Takes a Card object that is used by the functionality
16
17        Parameters
18        ----------
19        card : Card
20            a Card object on which the functionality works
21        """
