23        self.function_type = self.card.function_type()

Takes a Card object that is used by the functionality

Parameters
  • card (Card): a Card object on which the functionality works
card: Card
function_type = 0
class Channels: 
279class Channels:
280    """
281    a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's channel settings
282    """
283    
284    cards : list[Card] = []
285    channels : list[Channel]
286    num_channels : list[int]
287
288    def __init__(self, card : Card = None, card_enable : int = None, stack : CardStack = None, stack_enable : list[int] = None) -> None:
289        """
290        Constructor of the Channels class
291
292        Parameters
293        ----------
294        card : Card = None
295            The card to be used
296        card_enable : int = None
297            The bitmask to enable specific channels
298        stack : CardStack = None
299            The card stack to be used
300        stack_enable : list[int] = None
301            The list of bitmasks to enable specific channels
302
303        Raises
304        ------
305        SpcmException
306            No card or card stack provided
307        """
308
309        if card is not None:
310            self.cards.append(card)
311            if card_enable is not None:
312                self.channels_enable(enable_list=[card_enable])
313            else:
314                self.channels_enable(enable_all=True)
315        elif stack is not None:
316            self.cards = stack.cards
317            if stack_enable is not None:
318                self.channels_enable(enable_list=stack_enable)
319            else:
320                self.channels_enable(enable_all=True)
321        else:
322            raise SpcmException(text="No card or card stack provided")
323
324    def __str__(self) -> str:
325        """
326        String representation of the Channels class
327    
328        Returns
329        -------
330        str
331            String representation of the Channels class
332        """
333        
334        return f"Channels()"
335    
336    __repr__ = __str__
337
338    def __iter__(self) -> "Channels":
339        """Define this class as an iterator"""
340        return self
341    
342    def __getitem__(self, index : int) -> Channel:
343        """
344        This method is called to access the channel by index
345
346        Parameters
347        ----------
348        index : int
349            The index of the channel
350        
351        Returns
352        -------
353        Channel
354            the channel at the specific index
355        """
356
357        return self.channels[index]
358    
359    _channel_iterator_index = -1
360    def __next__(self) -> Channel:
361        """
362        This method is called when the next element is requested from the iterator
363
364        Returns
365        -------
366        Channel
367            the next available channel
368        
369        Raises
370        ------
371        StopIteration
372        """
373        self._channel_iterator_index += 1
374        if self._channel_iterator_index >= len(self.channels):
375            self._channel_iterator_index = -1
376            raise StopIteration
377        return self.channels[self._channel_iterator_index]
378    
379    def __len__(self) -> int:
380        """Returns the number of channels"""
381        return len(self.channels)
382    
383    def write_setup(self) -> None:
384        """Write the setup to the card"""
385        self.card.write_setup()
386    
387    def channels_enable(self, enable_list : list[int] = None, enable_all : bool = False) -> int:
388        """
389        Enables or disables the channels of all the available cards (see register `SPC_CHENABLE` in the manual)
390    
391        Parameters
392        ----------
393        enable_list : list[int] = None
394            A list of channels bitmasks to be enable or disable specific channels
395        enable_all : bool = False
396            Enable all the channels
397        
398        Returns
399        -------
400        int
401            A list with items that indicate for each card the number of channels that are enabled, or True to enable all channels.
402        """
403
404        if enable_all:
405            for card in self.cards:
406                num_channels = card.num_channels()
407                card.set_i(SPC_CHENABLE, (1 << num_channels) - 1)
408        elif enable_list is not None:
409            for enable, card in zip(enable_list, self.cards):
410                card.set_i(SPC_CHENABLE, enable)
411        self.channels = []
412        self.num_channels = []
413        num_channels = 0
414        for card in self.cards:
415            num_channels = card.get_i(SPC_CHCOUNT)
416            self.num_channels.append(num_channels)
417            for i in range(num_channels):
418                self.channels.append(Channel(i, card))
419        return sum(self.num_channels)
420        
421    # def __getattribute__(self, name):
422    #     # print("Calling __getattr__: {}".format(name))
423    #     if hasattr(Channel, name):
424    #         def wrapper(*args, **kw):
425    #             for channel in self.channels:
426    #                 getattr(channel, name)(*args, **kw)
427    #         return wrapper
428    #     else:
429    #         return object.__getattribute__(self, name)
430
431    def enable(self, enable : bool) -> None:
432        """
433        Enables or disables the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_ENABLEOUT` in the manual)
434    
435        Parameters
436        ----------
437        enable : bool
438            Turn-on (True) or off (False) the spezific channel
439        """
440
441        for channel in self.channels:
442            channel.enable(enable)
443    
444    def path(self, value : int) -> None:
445        """
446        Sets the input path of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_PATH` in the manual)
447    
448        Parameters
449        ----------
450        value : int
451            The input path of the specific channel
452        """
453
454        for channel in self.channels:
455            channel.path(value)
456        
457    def amp(self, value : int) -> None:
458        """
459        Sets the output/input range (amplitude) of the analog front-end of all channels of the card in mV (see register `SPC_AMP` in the manual)
460    
461        Parameters
462        ----------
463        value : int
464            The output range (amplitude) of all channels in millivolts
465        """
466
467        for channel in self.channels:
468            channel.amp(value)
469    
470    def offset(self, value : int) -> None:
471        """
472        Sets the offset of the analog front-end of all channels of the card in mV (see register `SPC_OFFSET` in the manual)
473    
474        Parameters
475        ----------
476        value : int
477            The offset of all channels in millivolts
478        """
479
480        for channel in self.channels:
481            channel.offset(value)
482
483    def termination(self, value : int) -> None:
484        """
485        Sets the termination of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_50OHM` in the manual)
486    
487        Parameters
488        ----------
489        value : int
490            The termination of all channels
491        """
492
493        for channel in self.channels:
494            channel.termination(value)
495    
496    def coupling(self, value : int) -> None:
497        """
498        Sets the coupling of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC` in the manual)
499    
500        Parameters
501        ----------
502        value : int
503            The coupling of all channels
504        """
505
506        for channel in self.channels:
507            channel.coupling(value)
508    
509    def coupling_offset_compensation(self, value : int) -> None:
510        """
511        Sets the coupling offset compensation of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION` in the manual)
512    
513        Parameters
514        ----------
515        value : int
516            The coupling offset compensation of all channels
517        """
518
519        for channel in self.channels:
520            channel.coupling_offset_compensation(value)
521    
522    def filter(self, value : int) -> None:
523        """
524        Sets the filter of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_FILTER` in the manual)
525    
526        Parameters
527        ----------
528        value : int
529            The filter of all channels
530        """
531
532        for channel in self.channels:
533            channel.filter(value)
534    
535    def stop_level(self, value : int) -> None:
536        """
537        Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. 
538        This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample,
539        to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will 
540        stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function
541        you can define the behavior after replay (see register `SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL` in the manual)
542    
543        Parameters
544        ----------
545        value : int
546            The wanted stop behaviour:
547        """
548
549        for channel in self.channels:
550            channel.stop_level(value)
551
552    def custom_stop(self, value : int) -> None:
553        """
554        Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is 
555        exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section.
556        When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to 
557        set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register `SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP` in the manual)
558    
559        Parameters
560        ----------
561        value : int
562            The custom stop value
563        """
564    
565        for channel in self.channels:
566            channel.custom_stop(value)

a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's channel settings

def write_setup(self) -> None:

Write the setup to the card

def channels_enable(self, enable_list: list[int] = None, enable_all: bool = False) -> int: 
387    def channels_enable(self, enable_list : list[int] = None, enable_all : bool = False) -> int:
388        """
389        Enables or disables the channels of all the available cards (see register `SPC_CHENABLE` in the manual)
390    
391        Parameters
392        ----------
393        enable_list : list[int] = None
394            A list of channels bitmasks to be enable or disable specific channels
395        enable_all : bool = False
396            Enable all the channels
397        
398        Returns
399        -------
400        int
401            A list with items that indicate for each card the number of channels that are enabled, or True to enable all channels.
402        """
403
404        if enable_all:
405            for card in self.cards:
406                num_channels = card.num_channels()
407                card.set_i(SPC_CHENABLE, (1 << num_channels) - 1)
408        elif enable_list is not None:
409            for enable, card in zip(enable_list, self.cards):
410                card.set_i(SPC_CHENABLE, enable)
411        self.channels = []
412        self.num_channels = []
413        num_channels = 0
414        for card in self.cards:
415            num_channels = card.get_i(SPC_CHCOUNT)
416            self.num_channels.append(num_channels)
417            for i in range(num_channels):
418                self.channels.append(Channel(i, card))
419        return sum(self.num_channels)

Parameters

  • enable_all (bool = False): Enable all the channels
Returns
  • int: A list with items that indicate for each card the number of channels that are enabled, or True to enable all channels.

def offset(self, value: int) -> None: 
470    def offset(self, value : int) -> None:
471        """
472        Sets the offset of the analog front-end of all channels of the card in mV (see register `SPC_OFFSET` in the manual)
473    
474        Parameters
475        ----------
476        value : int
477            The offset of all channels in millivolts
478        """
479
480        for channel in self.channels:
481            channel.offset(value)

Sets the offset of the analog front-end of all channels of the card in mV (see register SPC_OFFSET in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The offset of all channels in millivolts
def termination(self, value: int) -> None: 
483    def termination(self, value : int) -> None:
484        """
485        Sets the termination of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_50OHM` in the manual)
486    
487        Parameters
488        ----------
489        value : int
490            The termination of all channels
491        """
492
493        for channel in self.channels:
494            channel.termination(value)

Sets the termination of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register SPC_50OHM in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The termination of all channels
def coupling(self, value: int) -> None: 
496    def coupling(self, value : int) -> None:
497        """
498        Sets the coupling of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC` in the manual)
499    
500        Parameters
501        ----------
502        value : int
503            The coupling of all channels
504        """
505
506        for channel in self.channels:
507            channel.coupling(value)

Sets the coupling of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register SPC_ACDC in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The coupling of all channels
def coupling_offset_compensation(self, value: int) -> None: 
509    def coupling_offset_compensation(self, value : int) -> None:
510        """
511        Sets the coupling offset compensation of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION` in the manual)
512    
513        Parameters
514        ----------
515        value : int
516            The coupling offset compensation of all channels
517        """
518
519        for channel in self.channels:
520            channel.coupling_offset_compensation(value)

Sets the coupling offset compensation of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The coupling offset compensation of all channels
def filter(self, value: int) -> None: 
522    def filter(self, value : int) -> None:
523        """
524        Sets the filter of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register `SPC_FILTER` in the manual)
525    
526        Parameters
527        ----------
528        value : int
529            The filter of all channels
530        """
531

533            channel.filter(value)

Sets the filter of the analog front-end of all channels of the card (see register SPC_FILTER in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The filter of all channels
def stop_level(self, value: int) -> None: 
535    def stop_level(self, value : int) -> None:
536        """
537        Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. 
538        This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample,
539        to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will 
540        stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function
541        you can define the behavior after replay (see register `SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL` in the manual)
542    
543        Parameters
544        ----------
545        value : int
546            The wanted stop behaviour:
547        """
548
549        for channel in self.channels:
550            channel.stop_level(value)

Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample, to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function you can define the behavior after replay (see register SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The wanted stop behaviour:
def custom_stop(self, value: int) -> None: 
552    def custom_stop(self, value : int) -> None:
553        """
554        Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is 
555        exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section.
556        When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to 
557        set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register `SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP` in the manual)
558    
559        Parameters
560        ----------
561        value : int
562            The custom stop value
563        """
564    
565        for channel in self.channels:
566            channel.custom_stop(value)

Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section. When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The custom stop value
class Channel: 
 12class Channel:
 13    """A class to represent a channel of a card only used inside the Channels class in the list of channels"""
 14
 15    card : Card
 16    index : int
 17
 18    def __init__(self, index : int, card : Card) -> None:
 19        """
 20        Constructor of the Channel class
 21    
 22        Parameters
 23        ----------
 24        index : int
 25            The index of the channel
 26        card : Card
 27            The card of the channel
 28        """
 29
 30        self.card = card
 31        self.index = index
 32    
 33    def __str__(self) -> str:
 34        """
 35        String representation of the Channel class
 36    
 37        Returns
 38        -------
 39        str
 40            String representation of the Channel class
 41        """
 42        
 43        return f"Channel({self.index}, {self.card})"
 44    
 45    __repr__ = __str__
 46
 47    def __int__(self) -> int:
 48        """
 49        The Channel object acts like an int and returns the index of the channel and can also be used as the index in an array
 50
 51        Returns
 52        -------
 53        int
 54            The index of the channel
 55        """
 56        return self.index
 57    __index__ = __int__
 58    
 59    def __add__(self, other : int) -> int:
 60        """
 61        The Channel object again acts like an int and returns the index of the channel plus the other value
 62        
 63        Parameters
 64        ----------
 65        other : int
 66            The value to be added to the index of the channel
 67        
 68        Returns
 69        -------
 70        int
 71            The index of the channel plus the other value
 72        """
 73        return self.index + other
 74    
 75    def enable(self, enable : bool = None) -> bool:
 76        """
 77        Enables the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_ENABLEOUT` in the manual)
 78    
 79        Parameters
 80        ----------
 81        enable : bool
 82            Turn-on (True) or off (False) the spezific channel
 83
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        bool
 87            The enable state of the specific channel
 88        """
 89
 90        if enable is not None:
 91            self.card.set_i(SPC_ENABLEOUT0 + (SPC_ENABLEOUT1 - SPC_ENABLEOUT0) * self.index, int(enable))
 92        return bool(self.card.get_i(SPC_ENABLEOUT0 + (SPC_ENABLEOUT1 - SPC_ENABLEOUT0) * self.index))
 93    
 94    def path(self, value : int = None) -> int:
 95        """
 96        Sets the input path of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_PATH0` in the manual)
 97    
 98        Parameters
 99        ----------
100        value : int
101            The input path of the specific channel
102        
103        Returns
104        -------
105        int
106            The input path of the specific channel
107        """
108
109        if value is not None:
110            self.card.set_i(SPC_PATH0 + (SPC_PATH1 - SPC_PATH0) * self.index, value)
111        return self.card.get_i(SPC_PATH0 + (SPC_PATH1 - SPC_PATH0) * self.index)
112        
113    def amp(self, value : int = None) -> int:
114        """
115        Sets the output/input range (amplitude) of the analog front-end of the channel of the card in mV (see register `SPC_AMP` in the manual)
116    
117        Parameters
118        ----------
119        value : int
120            The output range (amplitude) of the specific channel in millivolts
121            
122        Returns
123        -------
124        int
125            The output range (amplitude) of the specific channel in millivolts
126        """
127
128        if value is not None:
129            self.card.set_i(SPC_AMP0 + (SPC_AMP1 - SPC_AMP0) * self.index, value)
130        return self.card.get_i(SPC_AMP0 + (SPC_AMP1 - SPC_AMP0) * self.index)
131
132    def offset(self, value : int = None) -> int:
133        """
134        Sets the offset of the analog front-end of the channel of the card in mV (see register `SPC_OFFSET` in the manual)
135    
136        Parameters
137        ----------
138        value : int
139            The offset of the specific channel in millivolts
140            
141        Returns
142        -------
143        int
144            The offset of the specific channel in millivolts
145        """
146
147        if value is not None:
148            self.card.set_i(SPC_OFFS0 + (SPC_OFFS1 - SPC_OFFS0) * self.index, value)
149        return self.card.get_i(SPC_OFFS0 + (SPC_OFFS1 - SPC_OFFS0) * self.index)
150
151    def termination(self, value : int) -> None:
152        """
153        Sets the termination of the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_50OHM0` in the manual)
154    
155        Parameters
156        ----------
157        value : int
158            The termination of the specific channel
159        """
160
161        self.card.set_i(SPC_50OHM0 + (SPC_50OHM1 - SPC_50OHM0) * self.index, value)
162
163    def get_termination(self) -> int:
164        """
165        Gets the termination of the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_50OHM0` in the manual)
166            
167        Returns
168        -------
169        int
170            The termination of the specific channel
171        """
172
173        return self.card.get_i(SPC_50OHM0 + (SPC_50OHM1 - SPC_50OHM0) * self.index)
174    
175    def coupling(self, value : int = None) -> int:
176        """
177        Sets the coupling of the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC0` in the manual)
178    
179        Parameters
180        ----------
181        value : int
182            The coupling of the specific channel
183            
184        Returns
185        -------
186        int
187            The coupling of the specific channel
188        """
189
190        if value is not None:
191            self.card.set_i(SPC_ACDC0 + (SPC_ACDC1 - SPC_ACDC0) * self.index, value)
192        return self.card.get_i(SPC_ACDC0 + (SPC_ACDC1 - SPC_ACDC0) * self.index)
193    
194    def coupling_offset_compensation(self, value : int = None) -> int:
195        """
196        Sets the coupling offset compensation of the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION0` in the manual)
197    
198        Parameters
199        ----------
200        value : int
201            The coupling offset compensation of the specific channel
202            
203        Returns
204        -------
205        int
206            The coupling offset compensation of the specific channel
207        """
208
209        if value is not None:
210            self.card.set_i(SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION0 + (SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION1 - SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION0) * self.index, value)
211        return self.card.get_i(SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION0 + (SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION1 - SPC_ACDC_OFFS_COMPENSATION0) * self.index)
212    
213    def filter(self, value : int = None) -> int:
214        """
215        Sets the filter of the analog front-end of the channel of the card (see register `SPC_FILTER0` in the manual)
216    
217        Parameters
218        ----------
219        value : int
220            The filter of the specific channel
221            
222        Returns
223        -------
224        int
225            The filter of the specific channel
226        """
227
228        if value is not None:
229            self.card.set_i(SPC_FILTER0 + (SPC_FILTER1 - SPC_FILTER0) * self.index, value)
230        return self.card.get_i(SPC_FILTER0 + (SPC_FILTER1 - SPC_FILTER0) * self.index)
231    
232    def stop_level(self, value : int = None) -> int:
233        """
234        Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. 
235        This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample,
236        to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will 
237        stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function
238        you can define the behavior after replay (see register `SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL` in the manual)
239    
240        Parameters
241        ----------
242        value : int
243            The wanted stop behaviour
244
245        Returns
246        -------
247        int
248            The stop behaviour of the specific channel
249        """
250
251        if value is not None:
252            self.card.set_i(SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL + self.index * (SPC_CH1_STOPLEVEL - SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL), value)
253        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL + self.index * (SPC_CH1_STOPLEVEL - SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL))
254
255    def custom_stop(self, value : int = None) -> int:
256        """
257        Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is 
258        exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section.
259        When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to 
260        set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register `SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP` in the manual)
261    
262        Parameters
263        ----------
264        value : int
265            The custom stop value
266
267        Returns
268        -------
269        int
270            The custom stop value of the specific channel
271        """
272
273        if value is not None:
274            self.card.set_i(SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP + self.index * (SPC_CH1_CUSTOM_STOP - SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP), value)
275        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP + self.index * (SPC_CH1_CUSTOM_STOP - SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP))

A class to represent a channel of a card only used inside the Channels class in the list of channels

def stop_level(self, value: int = None) -> int: 
232    def stop_level(self, value : int = None) -> int:
233        """
234        Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. 
235        This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample,
236        to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will 
237        stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function
238        you can define the behavior after replay (see register `SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL` in the manual)
239    
240        Parameters
241        ----------
242        value : int
243            The wanted stop behaviour
244
245        Returns
246        -------
247        int
248            The stop behaviour of the specific channel
249        """
250
251        if value is not None:
252            self.card.set_i(SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL + self.index * (SPC_CH1_STOPLEVEL - SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL), value)
253        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL + self.index * (SPC_CH1_STOPLEVEL - SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL))

Usually the used outputs of the analog generation boards are set to zero level after replay. This is in most cases adequate. In some cases it can be necessary to hold the last sample, to output the maximum positive level or maximum negative level after replay. The stoplevel will stay on the defined level until the next output has been made. With this function you can define the behavior after replay (see register SPC_CH0_STOPLEVEL in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The wanted stop behaviour
Returns
  • int: The stop behaviour of the specific channel
def custom_stop(self, value: int = None) -> int: 
255    def custom_stop(self, value : int = None) -> int:
256        """
257        Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is 
258        exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section.
259        When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to 
260        set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register `SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP` in the manual)
261    
262        Parameters
263        ----------
264        value : int
265            The custom stop value
266
267        Returns
268        -------
269        int
270            The custom stop value of the specific channel
271        """
272
273        if value is not None:
274            self.card.set_i(SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP + self.index * (SPC_CH1_CUSTOM_STOP - SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP), value)
275        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP + self.index * (SPC_CH1_CUSTOM_STOP - SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP))

Allows to define a 16bit wide custom level per channel for the analog output to enter in pauses. The sample format is exactly the same as during replay, as described in the sample format section. When synchronous digital bits are replayed along, the custom level must include these as well and therefore allows to set a custom level for each multi-purpose line separately. (see register SPC_CH0_CUSTOM_STOP in the manual)

Parameters
  • value (int): The custom stop value
Returns
  • int: The custom stop value of the specific channel
class Clock(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
  8class Clock(CardFunctionality):
  9    """a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's clock engine"""
 10    
 11    def __str__(self) -> str:
 12        """
 13        String representation of the Clock class
 14    
 15        Returns
 16        -------
 17        str
 18            String representation of the Clock class
 19        """
 20        
 21        return f"Clock(card={self.card})"
 22    
 23    __repr__ = __str__
 24    
 25    def write_setup(self) -> None:
 26        """Write the setup to the card"""
 27        self.card.write_setup()
 28    
 29    
 30    def mode(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
 31        """
 32        Set the clock mode of the card (see register `SPC_CLOCKMODE` in the manual)
 33    
 34        Parameters
 35        ----------
 36        mode : int
 37            The clock mode of the card
 38        
 39        Returns
 40        -------
 41        int
 42            The clock mode of the card
 43        """
 44
 45        if mode is not None:
 46            self.card.set_i(SPC_CLOCKMODE, mode)
 47        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CLOCKMODE)
 48    
 49    def max_sample_rate(self) -> int:
 50        """
 51        Returns the maximum sample rate of the active card (see register `SPC_MIINST_MAXADCLOCK` in the manual)
 52    
 53        Returns
 54        -------
 55        int
 56        """
 57        
 58        return self.card.get_i(SPC_MIINST_MAXADCLOCK)
 59
 60    def sample_rate(self, sample_rate : int = 0) -> int:
 61        """
 62        Sets or gets the current sample rate of the handled card (see register `SPC_SAMPLERATE` in the manual)
 63
 64        Parameters
 65        ----------
 66        sample_rate : int = 0
 67            if the parameter sample_rate is given with the function call, then the card's sample rate is set to that value
 68            if the parameter sample_rate is not give, the method returns the actual sample rate
 69    
 70        Returns
 71        -------
 72        int
 73            the current sample rate in Samples/s
 74        """
 75        
 76        if sample_rate:
 77            self.card.set_i(SPC_SAMPLERATE, int(sample_rate))
 78        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SAMPLERATE)
 79    
 80    def clock_output(self, clock_output : int = None) -> int:
 81        """
 82        Set the clock output of the card (see register `SPC_CLOCKOUT` in the manual)
 83        
 84        Parameters
 85        ----------
 86        clock_output : int
 87            the clock output of the card
 88        
 89        Returns
 90        -------
 91        int
 92            the clock output of the card
 93        """
 94        
 95        if clock_output is not None:
 96            self.card.set_i(SPC_CLOCKOUT, clock_output)
 97        return self.card.get_i(SPC_CLOCKOUT)
 98    output = clock_output
 99    
100    def reference_clock(self, reference_clock : int = None) -> int:
101        """
102        Set the reference clock of the card (see register `SPC_REFERENCECLOCK` in the manual)
103        
104        Parameters
105        ----------
106        reference_clock : int
107            the reference clock of the card in Hz
108        
109        Returns
110        -------
111        int
112            the reference clock of the card in Hz
113        """
114        
115        if reference_clock is not None:
116            self.card.set_i(SPC_REFERENCECLOCK, reference_clock)
117        return self.card.get_i(SPC_REFERENCECLOCK)

a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's clock engine

class Trigger(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
  8class Trigger(CardFunctionality):
  9    """a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's Trigger engine"""
 10    
 11    def __str__(self) -> str:
 12        """
 13        String representation of the Trigger class
 14    
 15        Returns
 16        -------
 17        str
 18            String representation of the Trigger class
 19        """
 20        
 21        return f"Trigger(card={self.card})"
 22    
 23    __repr__ = __str__
 24
 25    def enable(self) -> None:
 26        """Enables the trigger engine (see command 'M2CMD_CARD_ENABLETRIGGER' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)"""
 27        self.card.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_ENABLETRIGGER)
 28    
 29    def disable(self) -> None:
 30        """Disables the trigger engine (see command 'M2CMD_CARD_DISABLETRIGGER' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)"""
 31        self.card.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_DISABLETRIGGER)
 32    
 33    def force(self) -> None:
 34        """Forces a trigger event if the hardware is still waiting for a trigger event. (see command 'M2CMD_CARD_FORCETRIGGER' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)"""
 35        self.card.cmd(M2CMD_CARD_FORCETRIGGER)
 36    
 37    def write_setup(self) -> None:
 38        """Write the trigger setup to the card"""
 39        self.card.write_setup()
 40    
 41    # OR Mask
 42    def or_mask(self, mask : int = None) -> int:
 43        """
 44        Set the OR mask for the trigger input lines (see register 'SPC_TRIG_ORMASK' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)
 45        
 46        Parameters
 47        ----------
 48        mask : int
 49            The OR mask for the trigger input lines
 50        
 51        Returns
 52        -------
 53        int
 54            The OR mask for the trigger input lines
 55        """
 56
 57        if mask is not None:
 58            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_ORMASK, mask)
 59        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_ORMASK)
 60

141    # Main external window trigger (ext0/Trg0)
142    def ext0_mode(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
143        """
144        Set the mode for the main external window trigger (ext0/Trg0) (see register 'SPC_TRIG_EXT0_MODE' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)
145        
146        Parameters
147        ----------
148        mode : int
149            The mode for the main external window trigger (ext0/Trg0)
150        
151        Returns
152        -------
153        int
154            The mode for the main external window trigger (ext0/Trg0)
155        """
156
157        if mode is not None:
158            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_MODE, mode)
159        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_MODE)
160    
161    # Trigger termination
162    def termination(self, termination : int = None) -> int:
163        """
164        Set the trigger termination (see register 'SPC_TRIG_TERM' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)
165        
166        Parameters
167        ----------
168        termination : int
169            The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
170        
171        Returns
172        -------
173        int
174            The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
175        """
176
177        if termination is not None:
178            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_TERM, termination)
179        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_TERM)
180    
181    # Trigger input coupling
182    def ext0_coupling(self, coupling : int = None) -> int:
183        """
184        Set the trigger input coupling (see hardware manual register name 'SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC')
185        
186        Parameters
187        ----------
188        coupling : int
189            The trigger input coupling: COUPLING_DC enables DC coupling, COUPLING_AC enables AC coupling for the external trigger 
190            input (AC coupling is the default).
191
192        Returns
193        -------
194        int
195            The trigger input coupling: COUPLING_DC enables DC coupling, COUPLING_AC enables AC coupling for the external trigger 
196            input (AC coupling is the default).
197        """
198
199        if coupling is not None:
200            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC, coupling)
201        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC)
202    
203    # ext1 trigger mode
204    def ext1_mode(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
205        """
206        Set the mode for the ext1 trigger (see register 'SPC_TRIG_EXT1_MODE' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)

def termination(self, termination: int = None) -> int: 
162    def termination(self, termination : int = None) -> int:
163        """
164        Set the trigger termination (see register 'SPC_TRIG_TERM' in chapter `Trigger` in the manual)
165        
166        Parameters
167        ----------
168        termination : int
169            The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
170        
171        Returns
172        -------
173        int
174            The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
175        """
176
177        if termination is not None:
178            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_TERM, termination)
179        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_TERM)

Set the trigger termination (see register 'SPC_TRIG_TERM' in chapter Trigger in the manual)

Parameters
  • termination (int): The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
Returns
  • int: The trigger termination: a 1 sets the 50 Ohm termination for external trigger signals. A 0 sets the high impedance termination
def ext0_coupling(self, coupling: int = None) -> int: 
182    def ext0_coupling(self, coupling : int = None) -> int:
183        """
184        Set the trigger input coupling (see hardware manual register name 'SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC')
185        
186        Parameters
187        ----------
188        coupling : int
189            The trigger input coupling: COUPLING_DC enables DC coupling, COUPLING_AC enables AC coupling for the external trigger 
190            input (AC coupling is the default).
191
192        Returns
193        -------
194        int
195            The trigger input coupling: COUPLING_DC enables DC coupling, COUPLING_AC enables AC coupling for the external trigger 
196            input (AC coupling is the default).
197        """
198
199        if coupling is not None:
200            self.card.set_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC, coupling)
201        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TRIG_EXT0_ACDC)

class MultiPurposeIOs(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
 89class MultiPurposeIOs(CardFunctionality):
 90    """a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's Multi purpose I/O functionality"""
 91
 92    xio_lines : list[MultiPurposeIO] = []
 93    num_xio_lines : int = None
 94
 95    def __init__(self, card : Card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 96        """
 97        Constructor for the MultiPurposeIO class
 98    
 99        Parameters
100        ----------
101        card : Card
102            The card object to communicate with the card
103        """
104
105        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
106
107        self.num_xio_lines = self.get_num_xio_lines()
108        self.load()
109    
110    def __str__(self) -> str:
111        """
112        String representation of the MultiPurposeIO class
113    
114        Returns
115        -------
116        str
117            String representation of the MultiPurposeIO class
118        """
119        
120        return f"MultiPurposeIOs(card={self.card})"
121    
122    __repr__ = __str__
123    def __iter__(self) -> "MultiPurposeIOs":
124        """Define this class as an iterator"""
125        return self
126    
127    def __getitem__(self, index : int) -> MultiPurposeIO:
128        """
129        Get the xio line at the given index
130
131        Parameters
132        ----------
133        index : int
134            The index of the xio line to be returned
135        
136        Returns
137        -------
138        MultiPurposeIO
139            The xio line at the given index
140        """
141
142        return self.xio_lines[index]
143    
144    _xio_iterator_index = -1
145    def __next__(self) -> MultiPurposeIO:
146        """
147        This method is called when the next element is requested from the iterator
148
149        Returns
150        -------
151        MultiPurposeIO
152            The next xio line in the iterator
153        
154        Raises
155        ------
156        StopIteration
157        """
158        self._xio_iterator_index += 1
159        if self._xio_iterator_index >= len(self.xio_lines):
160            self._xio_iterator_index = -1
161            raise StopIteration
162        return self.xio_lines[self._xio_iterator_index]
163    
164    def __len__(self) -> int:
165        """Returns the number of available xio lines of the card"""
166        return len(self.xio_lines)
167    
168
169    def get_num_xio_lines(self) -> int:
170        """
171        Returns the number of digital input/output lines of the card (see register 'SPCM_NUM_XIO_LINES' in chapter `Multi Purpose I/O Lines` in the manual)
172    
173        Returns
174        -------
175        int
176            The number of digital input/output lines of the card
177
178        """
179
180        return self.card.get_i(SPC_NUM_XIO_LINES)
181
182    def load(self) -> None:
183        """
184        Loads the digital input/output lines of the card
185        """
186
187        self.xio_lines = [MultiPurposeIO(self.card, x_index) for x_index in range(self.num_xio_lines)]
188    
189    def asyncio(self, output : int = None) -> int:
190        """
191        Sets the async input/output of the card (see register 'SPCM_XX_ASYNCIO' in chapter `Multi Purpose I/O Lines` in the manual)
192    
193        Parameters
194        ----------
195        output : int
196            The async input/output of the card
197
198        Returns
199        -------
200        int
201            The async input/output of the card
202        """
203
204        if output is not None:
205            self.card.set_i(SPCM_XX_ASYNCIO, output)
206        return self.card.get_i(SPCM_XX_ASYNCIO)

a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's Multi purpose I/O functionality

class MultiPurposeIO: 
 9class MultiPurposeIO:
10    """a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement the Card's Multi purpose I/O functionality"""
11
12    card : Card = None
13    x_index : int = None
14
15    def __init__(self, card : Card, x_index : int = None) -> None:
16        """
17        Constructor for the MultiPurposeIO class
18    
19        Parameters
20        ----------
21        card : Card
22            The card object to communicate with the card
23        x_index : int
24            The index of the digital input/output to be enabled.
25        """
26
27        self.card = card
28        self.x_index = x_index
29    
30    def __str__(self) -> str:
31        """
32        String representation of the MultiPurposeIO class
33    
34        Returns
35        -------
36        str
37            String representation of the MultiPurposeIO class
38        """
39        
40        return f"MultiPurposeIO(card={self.card}, x_index={self.x_index})"
41    
42    __repr__ = __str__
43
44    def avail_modes(self) -> int:
45        """
46        Returns the available modes of the digital input/output of the card (see register 'SPCM_X0_AVAILMODES' in chapter `Multi Purpose I/O Lines` in the manual)
47
48        Returns
49        -------
50        int
51            The available modes of the digital input/output
52        """
53
54        return self.get_i(SPCM_X0_AVAILMODES + self.x_index)
55
56    def x_mode(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
57        """
58        Sets the mode of the digital input/output of the card (see register 'SPCM_X0_MODE' in chapter `Multi Purpose I/O Lines` in the manual)
59    
60        Parameters
61        ----------
62        mode : int
63            The mode of the digital input/output
64        """
65
66        if mode is not None:
67            self.card.set_i(SPCM_X0_MODE + self.x_index, mode)
68        return self.card.get_i(SPCM_X0_MODE + self.x_index)
69

87        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DIGMODE0 + self.x_index)

class DataTransfer(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
 15class DataTransfer(CardFunctionality):
 16    """
 17    A high-level class to control Data Transfer to and from Spectrum Instrumentation cards.
 18
 19    This class is an iterator class that implements the functions `__iter__` and `__next__`.
 20    This allows the user to supply the class to a for loop and iterate over the data that 
 21    is transferred from or to the card. Each iteration will return a numpy array with a data
 22    block of size `notify_samples`. In case of a digitizer you can read the data from that 
 23    block and process it. In case of a generator you can write data to the block and it's 
 24    then transferred.
 25
 26    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 27    for your specific card.
 28
 29    Parameters
 30    ----------
 31    `buffer` : NDArray[np.int_]
 32        numpy object that can be used to write data into the spcm buffer
 33    `buffer_size`: int
 34        defines the size of the current buffer shared between the PC and the card
 35    `buffer_type`: int
 36        defines the type of data in the buffer that is used for the transfer
 37    `num_channels`: int
 38        defines the number of channels that are used for the transfer
 39    `bytes_per_sample`: int
 40        defines the number of bytes per sample
 41    `bits_per_sample`: int
 42        defines the number of bits per sample
 43
 44    """
 45    # public
 46    buffer_size : int = 0
 47    buffer_type : int
 48    num_channels : int = 0
 49    bytes_per_sample : int = 0
 50    bits_per_sample : int = 0
 51    _notify_samples : int = 0
 52
 53    @property
 54    def buffer(self) -> npt.NDArray[np.int_]:
 55        """The numpy buffer object that interfaces the Card and can be written and read from"""
 56        return self._np_buffer
 57    
 58    @buffer.setter
 59    def buffer(self, value) -> None:
 60        self._np_buffer = value
 61    
 62    @buffer.deleter
 63    def buffer(self) -> None:
 64        del self._np_buffer
 65
 66    # private
 67    _memory_size : int = 0
 68    _c_buffer = None # Internal numpy ctypes buffer object
 69    _buffer_alignment : int = 4096
 70    _np_buffer : npt.NDArray[np.int_] # Internal object on which the getter setter logic is working
 71    _8bit_mode : bool = False
 72
 73    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 74        """
 75        Initialize the DataTransfer object with a card object and additional arguments
 76
 77        Parameters
 78        ----------
 79        card : Card
 80            the card object that is used for the data transfer
 81        *args : list
 82            list of additional arguments
 83        **kwargs : dict
 84            dictionary of additional keyword arguments
 85        """
 86        
 87        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
 88        self.buffer_type = SPCM_BUF_DATA
 89        self._bytes_per_sample()
 90        self._bits_per_sample()
 91        self.num_channels = self.card.active_channels()
 92
 93    def memory_size(self, memory_size : int = None) -> int:
 94        """
 95        Sets the memory size in samples per channel. The memory size setting must be set before transferring 
 96        data to the card. (see register `SPC_MEMSIZE` in the manual)
 97        
 98        Parameters
 99        ----------
100        memory_size : int
101            the size of the memory in Bytes
102        """
103
104        if memory_size is not None:
105            self.card.set_i(SPC_MEMSIZE, memory_size)
106        self._memory_size = self.card.get_i(SPC_MEMSIZE)
107        return self._memory_size
108    
109    def notify_samples(self, notify_samples : int) -> None:
110        """
111        Set the number of samples to notify the user about
112        
113        Parameters
114        ----------
115        notify_samples : int
116            the number of samples to notify the user about
117        """
118        self._notify_samples = notify_samples
119    
120    def loops(self, loops : int = None) -> int:
121        """
122        Set the number of times the memory is replayed. If set to zero the generation will run continuously until it is 
123        stopped by the user.  (see register `SPC_LOOPS` in the manual)
124        
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        loops : int
128            the number of loops that the card should perform
129        """
130
131        if loops is not None:
132            self.card.set_i(SPC_LOOPS, loops)
133        return self.card.get_i(SPC_LOOPS)
134
135    def _bits_per_sample(self) -> int:
136        """
137        Get the number of bits per sample
138
139        Returns
140        -------
141        int
142            number of bits per sample
143        """
144        if self._8bit_mode:
145            return 8
146        self.bits_per_sample = self.card.bits_per_sample()
147    
148    def _bytes_per_sample(self) -> int:
149        """
150        Get the number of bytes per sample
151
152        Returns
153        -------
154        int
155            number of bytes per sample
156        """
157        if self._8bit_mode:
158            return 1
159        self.bytes_per_sample = self.card.bytes_per_sample()
160    
161    def pre_trigger(self, num_samples : int = None) -> int:
162        """
163        Set the number of pre trigger samples (see register `SPC_PRETRIGGER` in the manual)
164        
165        Parameters
166        ----------
167        num_samples : int
168            the number of pre trigger samples
169        """
170
171        if num_samples is not None:
172            self.card.set_i(SPC_PRETRIGGER, num_samples)
173        return self.card.get_i(SPC_PRETRIGGER)
174    
175    def post_trigger(self, num_samples : int = None) -> int:
176        """
177        Set the number of post trigger samples (see register `SPC_POSTTRIGGER` in the manual)
178        
179        Parameters
180        ----------
181        num_samples : int
182            the number of post trigger samples
183        """
184
185        if num_samples is not None:
186            self.card.set_i(SPC_POSTTRIGGER, num_samples)
187        return self.card.get_i(SPC_POSTTRIGGER)
188    
189    def allocate_buffer(self, num_samples : int) -> None:
190        """
191        Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card
192
193        Parameters
194        ----------
195        num_samples : int = None
196            use the number of samples an get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
197        """
198        
199        sample_type = self.numpy_type()
200
201        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
202            self.buffer_size = num_samples * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
203        else:
204            self.buffer_size = num_samples * self.num_channels // 8
205
206        dwMask = self._buffer_alignment - 1
207
208        item_size = sample_type(0).itemsize
209        # allocate a buffer (numpy array) for DMA transfer: a little bigger one to have room for address alignment
210        databuffer_unaligned = np.empty(((self._buffer_alignment + self.buffer_size) // item_size, ), dtype = sample_type)   # half byte count at int16 sample (// = integer division)
211        # two numpy-arrays may share the same memory: skip the begin up to the alignment boundary (ArrayVariable[SKIP_VALUE:])
212        # Address of data-memory from numpy-array: ArrayVariable.__array_interface__['data'][0]
213        start_pos_samples = ((self._buffer_alignment - (databuffer_unaligned.__array_interface__['data'][0] & dwMask)) // item_size)
214        self.buffer = databuffer_unaligned[start_pos_samples:start_pos_samples + (self.buffer_size // item_size)]   # byte address but int16 sample: therefore / 2
215        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
216            self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((self.num_channels, num_samples), order='F')
217    
218    def start_buffer_transfer(self, *args, buffer_type=SPCM_BUF_DATA, direction=None, notify_samples=0, transfer_offset=0, transfer_length=None) -> None:
219        """
220        Start the transfer of the data to or from the card  (see the API function `spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64` in the manual)
221        
222        Parameters
223        ----------
224        *args : list
225            list of additonal arguments that are added as flags to the start dma command
226        buffer_type : int
227            the type of buffer that is used for the transfer
228        direction : int
229            the direction of the transfer
230        notify_samples : int
231            the number of samples to notify the user about
232        transfer_offset : int
233            the offset of the transfer
234        transfer_length : int
235            the length of the transfer
236
237        Raises
238        ------
239        SpcmException
240        """
241
242        if self.buffer is None: 
243            raise SpcmException(text="No buffer defined for transfer")
244        if buffer_type: 
245            self.buffer_type = buffer_type
246        if direction is None:
247            if self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_AI or self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_DI:
248                direction = SPCM_DIR_CARDTOPC
249            elif self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_AO or self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_DO:
250                direction = SPCM_DIR_PCTOCARD
251            else:
252                raise SpcmException(text="Please define a direction for transfer (SPCM_DIR_CARDTOPC or SPCM_DIR_PCTOCARD)")
253        
254        notify_size = 0
255        if notify_samples: 
256            self._notify_samples = notify_samples
257        if self._notify_samples: 
258            notify_size = self._notify_samples * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
259
260        if transfer_offset:
261            transfer_offset_bytes = transfer_offset * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
262        else:
263            transfer_offset_bytes = 0
264
265        if transfer_length is not None: 
266            transfer_length_bytes = transfer_length * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
267        else:
268            transfer_length_bytes = self.buffer_size
269        
270        # we define the buffer for transfer and start the DMA transfer
271        self.card._print("Starting the DMA transfer and waiting until data is in board memory")
272        self._c_buffer = self.buffer.ctypes.data_as(c_void_p)
273        spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64(self.card._handle, self.buffer_type, direction, notify_size, self._c_buffer, transfer_offset_bytes, transfer_length_bytes)
274        cmd = 0
275        for arg in args:
276            cmd |= arg
277        self.card.cmd(cmd)
278        self.card._print("... data transfer started")
279    
280    def avail_card_len(self, lAvailSamples : int = 0) -> None:
281        """
282        Set the amount of data that has been read out of the data buffer (see register `SPC_DATA_AVAIL_CARD_LEN` in the manual)
283
284        Parameters
285        ----------
286        lAvailSamples : int
287            the amount of data that is available for reading
288        """
289
290        self.card.set_i(SPC_DATA_AVAIL_CARD_LEN, lAvailSamples * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels)
291    
292    def avail_user_pos(self, bytes : bool = False) -> int:
293        """
294        Get the current position of the pointer in the data buffer (see register `SPC_DATA_AVAIL_USER_POS` in the manual)
295
296        Returns
297        -------
298        int
299            pointer position
300        """
301
302        user_pos = self.card.get_i(SPC_DATA_AVAIL_USER_POS)
303        if not bytes:
304            user_pos = user_pos // self.bytes_per_sample // self.num_channels
305        return user_pos
306    
307    def avail_user_len(self, bytes : bool = False) -> int:
308        """
309        Get the current length of the data in the data buffer (see register `SPC_DATA_AVAIL_USER_LEN` in the manual)
310
311        Returns
312        -------
313        int
314            data length available
315        """
316
317        user_len = self.card.get_i(SPC_DATA_AVAIL_USER_LEN)
318        if not bytes:
319            user_len = user_len // self.bytes_per_sample // self.num_channels
320        return user_len
321    
322    def fill_size_promille(self) -> int:
323        """
324        Get the fill size of the data buffer (see register `SPC_FILLSIZEPROMILLE` in the manual)
325
326        Returns
327        -------
328        int
329            fill size
330        """
331
332        return self.card.get_i(SPC_FILLSIZEPROMILLE)
333    
334    def wait_dma(self) -> None:
335        """
336        Wait for the DMA transfer to finish (see register `M2CMD_DATA_WAITDMA` in the manual)
337        """
338
339        self.card.cmd(M2CMD_DATA_WAITDMA)
340    wait = wait_dma
341
342    def numpy_type(self) -> npt.NDArray[np.int_]:
343        """
344        Get the type of numpy data from number of bytes
345
346        Returns
347        -------
348        numpy data type
349            the type of data that is used by the card
350        """
351        if self._8bit_mode:
352            return np.uint8
353        if self.bits_per_sample == 1:
354            if self.num_channels <= 8:
355                return np.uint8
356            elif self.num_channels <= 16:
357                return np.uint16
358            elif self.num_channels <= 32:
359                return np.uint32
360            return np.uint64
361        if self.bits_per_sample <= 8:
362            return np.int8
363        elif self.bits_per_sample <= 16:
364            return np.int16
365        elif self.bits_per_sample <= 32:
366            return np.int32
367        return np.int64
368
369    # 8-bit mode
370    def data_conversion(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
371        """
372        Set the data conversion mode (see register `SPC_DATACONVERSION` in the manual)
373        
374        Parameters
375        ----------
376        mode : int
377            the data conversion mode
378        """
379
380        if mode is not None:
381            self.card.set_i(SPC_DATACONVERSION, mode)
382        mode = self.card.get_i(SPC_DATACONVERSION)
383        self._8bit_mode = not (mode == SPCM_DC_NONE)
384        return self._8bit_mode
385    
386    def avail_data_conversion(self) -> int:
387        """
388        Get the available data conversion modes (see register `SPC_AVAILDATACONVERSION` in the manual)
389
390        Returns
391        -------
392        int
393            the available data conversion modes
394        """
395        return self.card.get_i(SPC_AVAILDATACONVERSION)
396    
397    # Iterator methods
398
399    _max_timeout = 64
400
401    _to_transfer_samples = 0
402    _current_samples = 0
403
404    def to_transfer_samples(self, samples: int) -> None:
405        """
406        This method sets the number of samples to transfer
407
408        Parameters
409        ----------
410        samples : int
411            the number of samples to transfer
412        """
413        self._to_transfer_samples = samples
414    
415    def __iter__(self):
416        """
417        This method is called when the iterator is initialized
418
419        Returns
420        -------
421        DataIterator
422            the iterator itself
423        """
424        return self
425    
426    def __next__(self) -> npt.ArrayLike:
427        """
428        This method is called when the next element is requested from the iterator
429
430        Returns
431        -------
432        npt.ArrayLike
433            the next data block
434        
435        Raises
436        ------
437        StopIteration
438        """
439        timeout_counter = 0
440        while True:
441            try:
442                self.wait_dma()
443            except SpcmTimeout:
444                self.card._print("... Timeout ({})".format(timeout_counter), end='\r')
445                timeout_counter += 1
446                if timeout_counter > self._max_timeout:
447                    raise StopIteration
448            else:
449                user_len = self.avail_user_len()
450                user_pos = self.avail_user_pos()
451
452                self._current_samples += self._notify_samples
453                if self._to_transfer_samples != 0 and self._to_transfer_samples < self._current_samples:
454                    raise StopIteration
455
456                fill_size = self.fill_size_promille()
457                self.card._print("Fill size: {}%  Pos:{:08x} Len:{:08x} Total:{:.2f} MiS / {:.2f} MiS".format(fill_size/10, user_pos, user_len, self._current_samples / MEBI(1), self._to_transfer_samples / MEBI(1)), end='\r')
458
459                self.avail_card_len(self._notify_samples)
460                return self.buffer[:, user_pos:user_pos+self._notify_samples]

A high-level class to control Data Transfer to and from Spectrum Instrumentation cards.

This class is an iterator class that implements the functions __iter__ and __next__. This allows the user to supply the class to a for loop and iterate over the data that is transferred from or to the card. Each iteration will return a numpy array with a data block of size notify_samples. In case of a digitizer you can read the data from that block and process it. In case of a generator you can write data to the block and it's then transferred.

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card.

Parameters
  • buffer (NDArray[np.int_]): numpy object that can be used to write data into the spcm buffer
  • buffer_size (int): defines the size of the current buffer shared between the PC and the card
  • buffer_type (int): defines the type of data in the buffer that is used for the transfer
  • num_channels (int): defines the number of channels that are used for the transfer
  • bytes_per_sample (int): defines the number of bytes per sample
  • bits_per_sample (int): defines the number of bits per sample
DataTransfer(card, *args, **kwargs) 
73    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
74        """
75        Initialize the DataTransfer object with a card object and additional arguments
76
77        Parameters
78        ----------
79        card : Card
80            the card object that is used for the data transfer
81        *args : list
82            list of additional arguments
83        **kwargs : dict
84            dictionary of additional keyword arguments
85        """
86        
87        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
88        self.buffer_type = SPCM_BUF_DATA
89        self._bytes_per_sample()
90        self._bits_per_sample()
91        self.num_channels = self.card.active_channels()

  • *args (list): list of additional arguments
  • **kwargs (dict): dictionary of additional keyword arguments

56        return self._np_buffer

def memory_size(self, memory_size: int = None) -> int: 
 93    def memory_size(self, memory_size : int = None) -> int:
 94        """
 95        Sets the memory size in samples per channel. The memory size setting must be set before transferring 
 96        data to the card. (see register `SPC_MEMSIZE` in the manual)
 97        
 98        Parameters
 99        ----------
100        memory_size : int
101            the size of the memory in Bytes
102        """
103
104        if memory_size is not None:
105            self.card.set_i(SPC_MEMSIZE, memory_size)
106        self._memory_size = self.card.get_i(SPC_MEMSIZE)
107        return self._memory_size

def loops(self, loops: int = None) -> int: 
120    def loops(self, loops : int = None) -> int:
121        """
122        Set the number of times the memory is replayed. If set to zero the generation will run continuously until it is 
123        stopped by the user.  (see register `SPC_LOOPS` in the manual)
124        
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        loops : int
128            the number of loops that the card should perform
129        """
130
131        if loops is not None:
132            self.card.set_i(SPC_LOOPS, loops)
133        return self.card.get_i(SPC_LOOPS)

def allocate_buffer(self, num_samples: int) -> None: 
189    def allocate_buffer(self, num_samples : int) -> None:
190        """
191        Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card
192
193        Parameters
194        ----------
195        num_samples : int = None
196            use the number of samples an get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
197        """
198        
199        sample_type = self.numpy_type()
200
201        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
202            self.buffer_size = num_samples * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
203        else:
204            self.buffer_size = num_samples * self.num_channels // 8
205
206        dwMask = self._buffer_alignment - 1
207
208        item_size = sample_type(0).itemsize
209        # allocate a buffer (numpy array) for DMA transfer: a little bigger one to have room for address alignment
210        databuffer_unaligned = np.empty(((self._buffer_alignment + self.buffer_size) // item_size, ), dtype = sample_type)   # half byte count at int16 sample (// = integer division)
211        # two numpy-arrays may share the same memory: skip the begin up to the alignment boundary (ArrayVariable[SKIP_VALUE:])
212        # Address of data-memory from numpy-array: ArrayVariable.__array_interface__['data'][0]
213        start_pos_samples = ((self._buffer_alignment - (databuffer_unaligned.__array_interface__['data'][0] & dwMask)) // item_size)
214        self.buffer = databuffer_unaligned[start_pos_samples:start_pos_samples + (self.buffer_size // item_size)]   # byte address but int16 sample: therefore / 2
215        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
216            self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((self.num_channels, num_samples), order='F')

Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card

Parameters
  • num_samples (int = None): use the number of samples an get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
def start_buffer_transfer( self, *args, buffer_type=1000, direction=None, notify_samples=0, transfer_offset=0, transfer_length=None) -> None: 
218    def start_buffer_transfer(self, *args, buffer_type=SPCM_BUF_DATA, direction=None, notify_samples=0, transfer_offset=0, transfer_length=None) -> None:
219        """
220        Start the transfer of the data to or from the card  (see the API function `spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64` in the manual)
221        
222        Parameters
223        ----------
224        *args : list
225            list of additonal arguments that are added as flags to the start dma command
226        buffer_type : int
227            the type of buffer that is used for the transfer
228        direction : int
229            the direction of the transfer
230        notify_samples : int
231            the number of samples to notify the user about
232        transfer_offset : int
233            the offset of the transfer
234        transfer_length : int
235            the length of the transfer
236
237        Raises
238        ------
239        SpcmException
240        """
241
242        if self.buffer is None: 
243            raise SpcmException(text="No buffer defined for transfer")
244        if buffer_type: 
245            self.buffer_type = buffer_type
246        if direction is None:
247            if self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_AI or self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_DI:
248                direction = SPCM_DIR_CARDTOPC
249            elif self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_AO or self.function_type == SPCM_TYPE_DO:
250                direction = SPCM_DIR_PCTOCARD
251            else:
252                raise SpcmException(text="Please define a direction for transfer (SPCM_DIR_CARDTOPC or SPCM_DIR_PCTOCARD)")
253        
254        notify_size = 0
255        if notify_samples: 
256            self._notify_samples = notify_samples
257        if self._notify_samples: 
258            notify_size = self._notify_samples * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
259
260        if transfer_offset:
261            transfer_offset_bytes = transfer_offset * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
262        else:
263            transfer_offset_bytes = 0
264
265        if transfer_length is not None: 
266            transfer_length_bytes = transfer_length * self.bytes_per_sample * self.num_channels
267        else:
268            transfer_length_bytes = self.buffer_size
269        
270        # we define the buffer for transfer and start the DMA transfer
271        self.card._print("Starting the DMA transfer and waiting until data is in board memory")
272        self._c_buffer = self.buffer.ctypes.data_as(c_void_p)
273        spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64(self.card._handle, self.buffer_type, direction, notify_size, self._c_buffer, transfer_offset_bytes, transfer_length_bytes)
274        cmd = 0
275        for arg in args:
276            cmd |= arg
277        self.card.cmd(cmd)
278        self.card._print("... data transfer started")

Start the transfer of the data to or from the card (see the API function spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64 in the manual)

Parameters
  • *args (list): list of additonal arguments that are added as flags to the start dma command
  • buffer_type (int): the type of buffer that is used for the transfer
  • direction (int): the direction of the transfer
  • notify_samples (int): the number of samples to notify the user about
  • transfer_offset (int): the offset of the transfer
  • transfer_length (int): the length of the transfer
Raises
  • SpcmException

def numpy_type(self) -> numpy.ndarray[typing.Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.int32]]: 
342    def numpy_type(self) -> npt.NDArray[np.int_]:
343        """
344        Get the type of numpy data from number of bytes
345
346        Returns
347        -------
348        numpy data type
349            the type of data that is used by the card
350        """
351        if self._8bit_mode:
352            return np.uint8
353        if self.bits_per_sample == 1:
354            if self.num_channels <= 8:
355                return np.uint8
356            elif self.num_channels <= 16:
357                return np.uint16
358            elif self.num_channels <= 32:
359                return np.uint32
360            return np.uint64
361        if self.bits_per_sample <= 8:
362            return np.int8
363        elif self.bits_per_sample <= 16:
364            return np.int16
365        elif self.bits_per_sample <= 32:
366            return np.int32
367        return np.int64
