class DDS(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
 11class DDS(CardFunctionality):
 12    """a higher-level abstraction of the SpcmCardFunctionality class to implement DDS functionality
 13
 14    The DDS firmware allows the user a certain maximum number of dds cores, that 
 15    each on it's own generates a sine wave with the following parameters:
 16    * static parameters:
 17        + frequency
 18        + amplitude
 19        + phase
 20    * dynamic parameters:
 21        + frequency_slope
 22            changes the active frequency of the dds core with a linear slope
 23        + amplitude_slope
 24            changes the active amplitude of the dds core with a linear slope
 25    Each of these cores can either be added together and outputted, or specific groups
 26    of cores can be added together and outputted on a specific hardware output channel.
 27    Furthermore, specific dds cores can be connected to input parameters of another dds core.
 28
 29    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 30    for your specific card.
 31
 32    Commands
 33    ---------
 34    The DDS functionality is controlled through commands that are listed and then written to the card.
 35    These written lists of commands are collected in a shadow register and are transferred to 
 36    the active register when a trigger is received.
 37    
 38    There are three different trigger sources, that can be set with the method 'trg_source()':
 39    * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE  = 0
 40        no triggers are generated and the commands are only transfered to the active register
 41        when a exec_now command is send
 42    * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1
 43        the triggers are generated on a timed grid with a period that can be set by the 
 44        method 'trg_timer()'
 45    * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD  = 2
 46        the triggers come from the card internal trigger logic (for more information, 
 47        see our product's user manual on how to setup the different triggers). In the DDS-mode
 48        multiple triggers can be processed, as with the mode SPC_STD_REP_SINGLERESTART.
 49    
 50    Note
 51    ----
 52    also the trigger source setting happens when a trigger comes. Hence a change of
 53    the trigger mode only happens after an 'arm()' command was send and an internal trigger was
 54    received.
 55 
 56    """
 57
 58    _dtm : int = 0
 59    _register_list : ctypes._Pointer
 60    _rl_size : int = MEBI(2)
 61    _rl_current : int = 0
 62
 63    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 64        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
 65
 66    def set_i(self, reg : int, value : int) -> None:
 67        """
 68        set an integer value to a register
 69
 70        Parameters
 71        ----------
 72        reg : int
 73            the register to be changed
 74        value : int
 75            the value to be set
 76        
 77        Raises
 78        ------
 79        SpcmException
 80            if the command list is full
 81        """
 82        if self._dtm == SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE:
 83            self.card.set_i(reg, value)
 84        else:
 85            if self._rl_current >= self._rl_size:
 86                raise SpcmException(text="Commands list is full, please write to card.")
 87            
 88            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lReg = reg
 89            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lType = TYPE_INT64
 90            self._register_list[self._rl_current].llValue = value
 91            self._rl_current += 1
 92
 93            if reg == SPC_DDS_CMD and (value & SPCM_DDS_CMD_WRITE_TO_CARD):
 94                self.card.set_ptr(SPC_REGISTER_LIST, self._register_list, self._rl_current * ctypes.sizeof(ST_LIST_PARAM))
 95                self._rl_current = 0
 96            
 97            if reg == SPC_DDS_CMD and (value & SPCM_DDS_CMD_RESET):
 98                self._rl_current = 0
 99    
100    def set_d(self, reg : int, value : float) -> None:
101        """
102        set a double value to a register
103
104        Parameters
105        ----------
106        reg : int
107            the register to be changed
108        value : float
109            the value to be set
110        """
111        if self._dtm == SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE:
112            self.card.set_d(reg, value)
113        else:
114            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lReg = reg
115            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lType = TYPE_DOUBLE
116            self._register_list[self._rl_current].dValue = value
117            self._rl_current += 1
118
119    def reset(self) -> None:
120        """
121        Resets the DDS specific part of the firmware (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
122        """
123
124        self.cmd(SPCM_DDS_CMD_RESET)
125    
126    # DDS information
127    def num_cores(self) -> int:
128        """
129        get the total num of available cores on the card. (see register `SPC_DDS_NUM_CORES` in the manual)
130
131        Returns
132        -------
133        int
134            the available number of dds cores
135        """
136        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_NUM_CORES)
137    
138    def queue_cmd_max(self):
139        """
140        get the total number of commands that can be hold by the queue. (see register `SPC_DDS_QUEUE_CMD_MAX` in the manual)
141
142        Returns
143        -------
144        int
145            the total number of commands
146        """
147        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_QUEUE_CMD_MAX)
148    
149    def queue_cmd_count(self):
150        """
151        get the current number of commands that are in the queue. (see register `SPC_DDS_QUEUE_CMD_COUNT` in the manual)
152
153        Returns
154        -------
155        int
156            the current number of commands
157        """
158        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_QUEUE_CMD_COUNT)
159    
160    def status(self):
161        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_STATUS)
162
163    # DDS setup settings
164    def data_transfer_mode(self, mode : int) -> None:
165        """
166        set the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register `SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE` in the manual)
167
168        Parameters
169        ----------
170        mode : int
171            the data transfer mode:
172            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0
173                the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
174            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1
175                the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
176        """
177
178        self._dtm = mode
179        if mode == SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA:
180            self.allocate_register_list()
181        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE, mode)
182    
183    def get_data_transfer_mode(self) -> int:
184        """
185        get the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register `SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE` in the manual)
186
187        Returns
188        -------
189        int
190            the data transfer mode:
191            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0
192                the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
193            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1
194                the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
195        """
196
197        self._dtm = self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE)
198        return self._dtm
199    
200    def allocate_register_list(self) -> None:
201        """
202        allocate memory for the register list
203        """
204        elems = (ST_LIST_PARAM * self._rl_size)()
205        self._register_list = ctypes.cast(elems,ctypes.POINTER(ST_LIST_PARAM))
206    
207    def phase_behaviour(self, behaviour : int) -> None:
208        """
209        set the phase behaviour of the DDS cores (see register `SPC_DDS_PHASE_BEHAVIOUR` in the manual)
210
211        Parameters
212        ----------
213        behaviour : int
214            the phase behaviour
215        """
216
217        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_PHASE_BEHAVIOUR, behaviour)
218    
219    def get_phase_behaviour(self) -> int:
220        """
221        get the phase behaviour of the DDS cores (see register `SPC_DDS_PHASE_BEHAVIOUR` in the manual)
222
223        Returns
224        -------
225        int
226            the phase behaviour
227        """
228
229        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_PHASE_BEHAVIOUR)
230
231    def cores_on_channel(self, channel : int, *args) -> None:
232        """
233        setup the cores that are connected to a specific channel (see register `SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0` in the manual)
234
235        Parameters
236        ----------
237        channel : int
238            the channel number
239        *args : int
240            the cores that are connected to the channel
241        """
242
243        mask = 0
244        for core in args:
245            mask |= core
246        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0 + channel, mask)
247    
248    def get_cores_on_channel(self, channel : int) -> int:
249        """
250        get the cores that are connected to a specific channel (see register `SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0` in the manual)
251
252        Parameters
253        ----------
254        channel : int
255            the channel number
256
257        Returns
258        -------
259        int
260            the cores that are connected to the channel
261        """
262
263        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0 + channel)
264
265    def trg_src(self, src : int) -> None:
266        """
267        setup the source of where the trigger is coming from (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC` in the manual)
268
269        NOTE
270        ---
271        the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --
272        
273        Parameters
274        ----------
275        src : int
276            set the trigger source:
277            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE  = 0
278                no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
279            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1
280                an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by `trg_timer(period)`
281            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD  = 2
282                use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
283        """
284
285        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC, src)
286
287    def get_trg_src(self) -> int:
288        """
289        get the source of where the trigger is coming from (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC` in the manual)
290
291        NOTE
292        ----
293        the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --
294        
295        Returns
296        ----------
297        int
298            get one of the trigger source:
299            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE  = 0
300                no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
301            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1
302                an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by `trg_timer(period)`
303            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD  = 2
304                use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
305        """
306
307        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC)
308    
309    def trg_timer(self, period : float) -> None:
310        """
311        set the period at which the timer should raise DDS trigger events. (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_TIMER` in the manual)
312
313        NOTE
314        ----
315        only used in conjecture with the trigger source set to SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER ---
316        
317        Parameters
318        ----------
319        period : float
320            the time between DDS trigger events in seconds
321        """
322
323        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_TRG_TIMER, float(period))
324    
325    def get_trg_timer(self) -> float:
326        """
327        get the period at which the timer should raise DDS trigger events. (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_TIMER` in the manual)
328
329        NOTE
330        ----
331        only used in conjecture with the trigger source set to SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER ---
332        
333        Returns
334        ----------
335        float
336            the time between DDS trigger events in seconds
337        """
338
339        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_TRG_TIMER)
340
341    def x_mode(self, xio : int, mode : int) -> None:
342        """
343        setup the kind of output that the XIO outputs will give (see register `SPC_DDS_X0_MODE` in the manual)
344
345        Parameters
346        ----------
347        xio : int
348            the XIO channel number
349        mode : int
350            the mode that the channel needs to run in
351        """
352
353        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_X0_MODE + xio, mode)
354
355    def get_x_mode(self, xio : int) -> int:
356        """
357        get the kind of output that the XIO outputs will give (see register `SPC_DDS_X0_MODE` in the manual)
358
359        Parameters
360        ----------
361        xio : int
362            the XIO channel number
363
364        Returns
365        -------
366        int
367            the mode that the channel needs to run in
368            SPC_DDS_XIO_SEQUENCE = 0
369                turn on and off the XIO channels using commands in the DDS cmd queue
370            SPC_DDS_XIO_ARM = 1
371                when the DDS firmware is waiting for a trigger to come this signal is high
372            SPC_DDS_XIO_LATCH = 2
373                when the DDS firmware starts executing a change this signal is high
374        """
375
376        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_X0_MODE + xio)
377
378    def freq_ramp_stepsize(self, divider : int) -> None:
379        """
380        number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
381
382        NOTES
383        -----
384        - this is a global setting for all cores
385        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
386        
387        Parameters
388        ----------
389        divider : int
390            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
391        """
392
393        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE, int(divider))
394
395    def get_freq_ramp_stepsize(self) -> int:
396        """
397        get the number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
398        
399        NOTES
400        -----
401        - this is a global setting for all cores
402        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
403        
404        Returns
405        ----------
406        divider : int
407            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
408        """
409
410        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE)
411
412    def amp_ramp_stepsize(self, divider : int) -> None:
413        """
414        number of timesteps before the amplitude is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
415
416        NOTES
417        -----
418        - this is a global setting for all cores
419        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given amplitude slope, 
420            please set the time divider before setting the amplitude slope
421        
422        Parameters
423        ----------
424        divider : int
425            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during an amplitude ramp
426        """
427
428        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE, int(divider))
429
430    def get_amp_ramp_stepsize(self) -> int:
431        """
432        get the number of timesteps before the amplitude is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
433
434        NOTES
435        -----
436        - this is a global setting for all cores
437        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given amplitude slope, 
438            please set the time divider before setting the amplitude slope
439        
440        Returns
441        ----------
442        divider : int
443            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during an amplitude ramp
444        """
445
446        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE)
447
448    # DDS "static" parameters
449    def amp(self, core_index : int, amplitude : float) -> None:
450        """
451        set the amplitude of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP` in the manual)
452        
453        Parameters
454        ----------
455        core_index : int
456            the index of the core to be changed
457        amplitude : float
458            the value between 0 and 1 corresponding to the amplitude
459        """
460
461        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP + core_index, float(amplitude))
462    # aliases
463    amplitude = amp
464
465    def get_amp(self, core_index : int) -> float:
466        """
467        gets the amplitude of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP` in the manual)
468        
469        Parameters
470        ----------
471        core_index : int
472            the index of the core to be changed
473
474        Returns
475        -------
476        float
477            the value between 0 and 1 corresponding to the amplitude
478        """
479
480        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP + core_index)
481    # aliases
482    get_amplitude = get_amp
483
484    def avail_amp_min(self) -> float:
485        """
486        get the minimum available amplitude (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_MIN` in the manual)
487
488        Returns
489        -------
490        float
491            the minimum available amplitude
492        """
493
494        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_MIN)
495    
496    def avail_amp_max(self) -> float:
497        """
498        get the maximum available amplitude (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_MAX` in the manual)
499
500        Returns
501        -------
502        float
503            the maximum available amplitude
504        """
505
506        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_MAX)
507    
508    def avail_amp_step(self) -> float:
509        """
510        get the step size of the available amplitudes (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_STEP` in the manual)
511
512        Returns
513        -------
514        float
515            the step size of the available amplitudes
516        """
517
518        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_STEP)
519
520    def freq(self, core_index : int, frequency : float) -> None:
521        """
522        set the frequency of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ` in the manual)
523        
524        Parameters
525        ----------
526        core_index : int
527            the index of the core to be changed
528        frequency : float
529            the value of the frequency in Hz
530        """
531
532        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ + core_index, float(frequency))
533    # aliases
534    frequency = freq
535
536    def get_freq(self, core_index : int) -> float:
537        """
538        gets the frequency of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ` in the manual)
539        
540        Parameters
541        ----------
542        core_index : int
543            the index of the core to be changed
544        
545        Returns
546        -------
547        float
548            the value of the frequency in Hz the specific core
549        """
550
551        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ + core_index)
552    # aliases
553    get_frequency = get_freq
554
555    def avail_freq_min(self) -> float:
556        """
557        get the minimum available frequency (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_MIN` in the manual)
558
559        Returns
560        -------
561        float
562            the minimum available frequency
563        """
564
565        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_MIN)
566    
567    def avail_freq_max(self) -> float:
568        """
569        get the maximum available frequency (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_MAX` in the manual)
570
571        Returns
572        -------
573        float
574            the maximum available frequency
575        """
576
577        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_MAX)
578    
579    def avail_freq_step(self) -> float:
580        """
581        get the step size of the available frequencies (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_STEP` in the manual)
582
583        Returns
584        -------
585        float
586            the step size of the available frequencies
587        """
588
589        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_STEP)
590
591    def phase(self, core_index : int, phase : float) -> None:
592        """
593        set the phase of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_PHASE` in the manual)
594        
595        Parameters
596        ----------
597        core_index : int
598            the index of the core to be changed
599        phase : float
600            the value between 0 and 360 degrees of the phase
601        """
602
603        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_PHASE + core_index, float(phase))
604
605    def get_phase(self, core_index : int) -> float:
606        """
607        gets the phase of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_PHASE` in the manual)
608        
609        Parameters
610        ----------
611        core_index : int
612            the index of the core to be changed
613        
614        Returns
615        -------
616        float
617            the value between 0 and 360 degrees of the phase
618        """
619
620        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_PHASE + core_index)
621    
622    def avail_phase_min(self) -> float:
623        """
624        get the minimum available phase (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_MIN` in the manual)
625
626        Returns
627        -------
628        float
629            the minimum available phase
630        """
631
632        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_MIN)
633    
634    def avail_phase_max(self) -> float:
635        """
636        get the maximum available phase (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_MAX` in the manual)
637
638        Returns
639        -------
640        float
641            the maximum available phase
642        """
643
644        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_MAX)
645    
646    def avail_phase_step(self) -> float:
647        """
648        get the step size of the available phases (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_STEP` in the manual)
649
650        Returns
651        -------
652        float
653            the step size of the available phases
654        """
655
656        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_PHASE_STEP)
657
658    def x_manual_output(self, state_mask : int) -> None:
659        """
660        set the output of the xio channels using a bit mask (see register `SPC_DDS_X_MANUAL_OUTPUT` in the manual)
661        
662        Parameters
663        ----------
664        state_mask : int
665            bit mask where the bits correspond to specific channels and 1 to on and 0 to off.
666        """
667
668        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_X_MANUAL_OUTPUT, state_mask)
669
670    def get_x_manual_output(self) -> int:
671        """
672        get the output of the xio channels using a bit mask (see register `SPC_DDS_X_MANUAL_OUTPUT` in the manual)
673        
674        Returns
675        ----------
676        int
677            bit mask where the bits correspond to specific channels and 1 to on and 0 to off.
678        """
679
680        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_X_MANUAL_OUTPUT)
681
682    # DDS dynamic parameters
683    def freq_slope(self, core_index : int, slope : float) -> None:
684        """
685        set the frequency slope of the linearly changing frequency of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ_SLOPE` in the manual)
686        
687        Parameters
688        ----------
689        core_index : int
690            the index of the core to be changed
691        slope : float
692            the rate of frequency change in Hz/s
693        """
694
695        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ_SLOPE + core_index, float(slope))
696    # aliases
697    frequency_slope = freq_slope
698
699    def get_freq_slope(self, core_index : int) -> float:
700        """
701        get the frequency slope of the linearly changing frequency of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ_SLOPE` in the manual)
702        
703        Parameters
704        ----------
705        core_index : int
706            the index of the core to be changed
707        
708        Returns
709        -------
710        float
711            the rate of frequency change in Hz/s
712        """
713
714        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_FREQ_SLOPE + core_index)
715    # aliases
716    get_frequency_slope = get_freq_slope
717
718    def avail_freq_slope_min(self) -> float:
719        """
720        get the minimum available frequency slope (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_MIN` in the manual)
721
722        Returns
723        -------
724        float
725            the minimum available frequency slope
726        """
727
728        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_MIN)
729    
730    def avail_freq_slope_max(self) -> float:
731        """
732        get the maximum available frequency slope (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_MAX` in the manual)
733
734        Returns
735        -------
736        float
737            the maximum available frequency slope
738        """
739
740        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_MAX)
741    
742    def avail_freq_slope_step(self) -> float:
743        """
744        get the step size of the available frequency slopes (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_STEP` in the manual)
745
746        Returns
747        -------
748        float
749            the step size of the available frequency slopes
750        """
751
752        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_FREQ_SLOPE_STEP)
753
754    def amp_slope(self, core_index : int, slope : float) -> None:
755        """
756        set the amplitude slope of the linearly changing amplitude of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP_SLOPE` in the manual)
757        
758        Parameters
759        ----------
760        core_index : int
761            the index of the core to be changed
762        slope : float
763            the rate of amplitude change in 1/s
764        """
765
766        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP_SLOPE + core_index, float(slope))
767    # aliases
768    amplitude_slope = amp_slope
769
770    def get_amp_slope(self, core_index : int) -> float:
771        """
772        set the amplitude slope of the linearly changing amplitude of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP_SLOPE` in the manual)
773        
774        Parameters
775        ----------
776        core_index : int
777            the index of the core to be changed
778        
779        Returns
780        -------
781        float
782            the rate of amplitude change in 1/s
783        """
784
785        self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP_SLOPE + core_index)
786    # aliases
787    amplitude_slope = amp_slope
788
789    def avail_amp_slope_min(self) -> float:
790        """
791        get the minimum available amplitude slope (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_MIN` in the manual)
792
793        Returns
794        -------
795        float
796            the minimum available amplitude slope
797        """
798
799        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_MIN)
800    
801    def avail_amp_slope_max(self) -> float:
802        """
803        get the maximum available amplitude slope (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_MAX` in the manual)
804
805        Returns
806        -------
807        float
808            the maximum available amplitude slope
809        """
810
811        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_MAX)
812    
813    def avail_amp_slope_step(self) -> float:
814        """
815        get the step size of the available amplitude slopes (see register `SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_STEP` in the manual)
816
817        Returns
818        -------
819        float
820            the step size of the available amplitude slopes
821        """
822
823        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_STEP)
824
825    # DDS control
826    def cmd(self, command : int) -> None:
827        """
828        execute a DDS specific control flow command (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
829        
830        Parameters
831        ----------
832        command : int
833            DDS specific command
834        """
835
836        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_CMD, command)
837
838    def exec_at_trg(self) -> None:
839        """
840        execute the commands in the shadow register at the next trigger event (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
841        """
842        self.cmd(SPCM_DDS_CMD_EXEC_AT_TRG)
843    # aliases
844    arm = exec_at_trg
845    wait_for_trg = exec_at_trg
846    
847    def exec_now(self) -> None:
848        """
849        execute the commands in the shadow register as soon as possible (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
850        """
851
852        self.cmd(SPCM_DDS_CMD_EXEC_NOW)
853    # aliases
854    direct_latch = exec_now
855
856    def trg_count(self) -> int:
857        """
858        get the number of trigger exec_at_trg and exec_now command that have been executed (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_COUNT` in the manual)
859
860        Returns
861        -------
862        int
863            the number of trigger exec_at_trg and exec_now command that have been executed
864        """
865
866        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_TRG_COUNT)
867    
868    def write_to_card(self, flags=0) -> None:
869        """
870        send a list of all the commands that came after the last write_list and send them to the card (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
871        """
872        
873        self.cmd(SPCM_DDS_CMD_WRITE_TO_CARD | flags)
874    
875    # DDS helper functions
876    def kwargs2mask(self, kwargs : dict[str, bool], prefix : str = "") -> int:
877        """
878        DDS helper: transform a dictionary with keys with a specific prefix to a bitmask
879
880        Parameters
881        ----------
882        kwargs : dict
883            dictonary with keys with a specific prefix and values given by bools
884        prefix : str
885            a prefix for the key names
886        
887        Returns
888        -------
889        int
890            bit mask
891        
892        Example
893        -------
894        ['core_0' = True, 'core_2' = False, 'core_3' = True] => 0b1001 = 9
895        """
896        
897        mask = 0
898        for keyword, value in kwargs.items():
899            bit = int(keyword[len(prefix)+1:])
900            if value:
901                mask |= 1 << bit
902            else:
903                mask &= ~(1 << bit)
904        return mask
905    # aliases
906    k2m = kwargs2mask

a higher-level abstraction of the SpcmCardFunctionality class to implement DDS functionality

The DDS firmware allows the user a certain maximum number of dds cores, that each on it's own generates a sine wave with the following parameters:

  • static parameters:
    • frequency
    • amplitude
    • phase
  • dynamic parameters:
    • frequency_slope changes the active frequency of the dds core with a linear slope
    • amplitude_slope changes the active amplitude of the dds core with a linear slope Each of these cores can either be added together and outputted, or specific groups of cores can be added together and outputted on a specific hardware output channel. Furthermore, specific dds cores can be connected to input parameters of another dds core.

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card.

Commands

The DDS functionality is controlled through commands that are listed and then written to the card. These written lists of commands are collected in a shadow register and are transferred to the active register when a trigger is received.

There are three different trigger sources, that can be set with the method 'trg_source()':

  • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE = 0 no triggers are generated and the commands are only transfered to the active register when a exec_now command is send
  • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1 the triggers are generated on a timed grid with a period that can be set by the method 'trg_timer()'
  • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD = 2 the triggers come from the card internal trigger logic (for more information, see our product's user manual on how to setup the different triggers). In the DDS-mode multiple triggers can be processed, as with the mode SPC_STD_REP_SINGLERESTART.
Note

also the trigger source setting happens when a trigger comes. Hence a change of the trigger mode only happens after an 'arm()' command was send and an internal trigger was received.

DDS(*args, **kwargs) 
63    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
64        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)

Takes a Card object that is used by the functionality

Parameters
  • card (Card): a Card object on which the functionality works
def set_i(self, reg: int, value: int) -> None: 
66    def set_i(self, reg : int, value : int) -> None:
67        """
68        set an integer value to a register
69
70        Parameters
71        ----------
72        reg : int
73            the register to be changed
74        value : int
75            the value to be set
76        
77        Raises
78        ------
79        SpcmException
80            if the command list is full
81        """
82        if self._dtm == SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE:
83            self.card.set_i(reg, value)
84        else:
85            if self._rl_current >= self._rl_size:
86                raise SpcmException(text="Commands list is full, please write to card.")
87            
88            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lReg = reg
89            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lType = TYPE_INT64
90            self._register_list[self._rl_current].llValue = value
91            self._rl_current += 1
92
93            if reg == SPC_DDS_CMD and (value & SPCM_DDS_CMD_WRITE_TO_CARD):
94                self.card.set_ptr(SPC_REGISTER_LIST, self._register_list, self._rl_current * ctypes.sizeof(ST_LIST_PARAM))
95                self._rl_current = 0
96            
97            if reg == SPC_DDS_CMD and (value & SPCM_DDS_CMD_RESET):
98                self._rl_current = 0

set an integer value to a register

Parameters
  • reg (int): the register to be changed
  • value (int): the value to be set
Raises
  • SpcmException: if the command list is full
def set_d(self, reg: int, value: float) -> None: 
100    def set_d(self, reg : int, value : float) -> None:
101        """
102        set a double value to a register
103
104        Parameters
105        ----------
106        reg : int
107            the register to be changed
108        value : float
109            the value to be set
110        """
111        if self._dtm == SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE:
112            self.card.set_d(reg, value)
113        else:
114            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lReg = reg
115            self._register_list[self._rl_current].lType = TYPE_DOUBLE
116            self._register_list[self._rl_current].dValue = value
117            self._rl_current += 1

set a double value to a register

Parameters
  • reg (int): the register to be changed
  • value (float): the value to be set

def data_transfer_mode(self, mode: int) -> None: 
164    def data_transfer_mode(self, mode : int) -> None:
165        """
166        set the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register `SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE` in the manual)
167
168        Parameters
169        ----------
170        mode : int
171            the data transfer mode:
172            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0
173                the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
174            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1
175                the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
176        """
177
178        self._dtm = mode
179        if mode == SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA:
180            self.allocate_register_list()
181        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE, mode)

set the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE in the manual)

Parameters
  • mode (int): the data transfer mode:
    • SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0 the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
    • SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1 the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
def get_data_transfer_mode(self) -> int: 
183    def get_data_transfer_mode(self) -> int:
184        """
185        get the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register `SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE` in the manual)
186
187        Returns
188        -------
189        int
190            the data transfer mode:
191            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0
192                the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
193            * SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1
194                the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
195        """
196
197        self._dtm = self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE)
198        return self._dtm

get the data transfer mode for the DDS functionality (see register SPC_DDS_DATA_TRANSFER_MODE in the manual)

Returns
  • int: the data transfer mode:
    • SPCM_DDS_DTM_SINGLE = 0 the data is transferred using single commands (with lower latency)
    • SPCM_DDS_DTM_DMA = 1 the data is transferred using DMA (with higher bandwidth)
def allocate_register_list(self) -> None: 
200    def allocate_register_list(self) -> None:
201        """
202        allocate memory for the register list
203        """
204        elems = (ST_LIST_PARAM * self._rl_size)()
205        self._register_list = ctypes.cast(elems,ctypes.POINTER(ST_LIST_PARAM))

allocate memory for the register list

def cores_on_channel(self, channel: int, *args) -> None: 
231    def cores_on_channel(self, channel : int, *args) -> None:
232        """
233        setup the cores that are connected to a specific channel (see register `SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0` in the manual)
234
235        Parameters
236        ----------
237        channel : int
238            the channel number
239        *args : int
240            the cores that are connected to the channel
241        """
242
243        mask = 0
244        for core in args:
245            mask |= core
246        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_CORES_ON_CH0 + channel, mask)

def trg_src(self, src: int) -> None: 
265    def trg_src(self, src : int) -> None:
266        """
267        setup the source of where the trigger is coming from (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC` in the manual)
268
269        NOTE
270        ---
271        the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --
272        
273        Parameters
274        ----------
275        src : int
276            set the trigger source:
277            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE  = 0
278                no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
279            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1
280                an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by `trg_timer(period)`
281            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD  = 2
282                use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
283        """
284
285        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC, src)

setup the source of where the trigger is coming from (see register SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC in the manual)

NOTE

the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --

Parameters
  • src (int): set the trigger source:
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE = 0 no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1 an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by trg_timer(period)
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD = 2 use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
def get_trg_src(self) -> int: 
287    def get_trg_src(self) -> int:
288        """
289        get the source of where the trigger is coming from (see register `SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC` in the manual)
290
291        NOTE
292        ----
293        the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --
294        
295        Returns
296        ----------
297        int
298            get one of the trigger source:
299            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE  = 0
300                no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
301            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1
302                an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by `trg_timer(period)`
303            * SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD  = 2
304                use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
305        """
306
307        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_TRG_SRC)

NOTE

the trigger source is also set using the shadow register, hence only after an exec_at_trig or exec_now --

  • int: get one of the trigger source:
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_NONE = 0 no trigger source set, only exec_now changes what is output by the cores
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_TIMER = 1 an internal timer sends out triggers with a period defined by trg_timer(period)
    • SPCM_DDS_TRG_SRC_CARD = 2 use the trigger engine of the card (see the user manual for more information about setting up the trigger engine)
def trg_timer(self, period: float) -> None:

def get_x_mode(self, xio: int) -> int: 
355    def get_x_mode(self, xio : int) -> int:
356        """
357        get the kind of output that the XIO outputs will give (see register `SPC_DDS_X0_MODE` in the manual)
358
359        Parameters
360        ----------
361        xio : int
362            the XIO channel number
363
364        Returns
365        -------
366        int
367            the mode that the channel needs to run in
368            SPC_DDS_XIO_SEQUENCE = 0
369                turn on and off the XIO channels using commands in the DDS cmd queue
370            SPC_DDS_XIO_ARM = 1
371                when the DDS firmware is waiting for a trigger to come this signal is high
372            SPC_DDS_XIO_LATCH = 2
373                when the DDS firmware starts executing a change this signal is high
374        """
375
376        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_X0_MODE + xio)

get the kind of output that the XIO outputs will give (see register SPC_DDS_X0_MODE in the manual)

Parameters
  • xio (int): the XIO channel number
Returns
  • int: the mode that the channel needs to run in SPC_DDS_XIO_SEQUENCE = 0 turn on and off the XIO channels using commands in the DDS cmd queue SPC_DDS_XIO_ARM = 1 when the DDS firmware is waiting for a trigger to come this signal is high SPC_DDS_XIO_LATCH = 2 when the DDS firmware starts executing a change this signal is high
def freq_ramp_stepsize(self, divider: int) -> None: 
378    def freq_ramp_stepsize(self, divider : int) -> None:
379        """
380        number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
381
382        NOTES
383        -----
384        - this is a global setting for all cores
385        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
386        
387        Parameters
388        ----------
389        divider : int
390            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
391        """
392
393        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE, int(divider))

number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE in the manual)

NOTES
  • this is a global setting for all cores
  • internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
Parameters
  • divider (int): the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
def get_freq_ramp_stepsize(self) -> int: 
395    def get_freq_ramp_stepsize(self) -> int:
396        """
397        get the number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
398        
399        NOTES
400        -----
401        - this is a global setting for all cores
402        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
403        
404        Returns
405        ----------
406        divider : int
407            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
408        """
409
410        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE)

get the number of timesteps before the frequency is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register SPC_DDS_FREQ_RAMP_STEPSIZE in the manual)

NOTES
  • this is a global setting for all cores
  • internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given frequency slope, please set the time divider before setting the frequency slope
Returns
  • divider (int): the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during a frequency ramp
def amp_ramp_stepsize(self, divider: int) -> None: 
412    def amp_ramp_stepsize(self, divider : int) -> None:
413        """
414        number of timesteps before the amplitude is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register `SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE` in the manual)
415
416        NOTES
417        -----
418        - this is a global setting for all cores
419        - internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given amplitude slope, 
420            please set the time divider before setting the amplitude slope
421        
422        Parameters
423        ----------
424        divider : int
425            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during an amplitude ramp
426        """
427
428        self.set_i(SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE, int(divider))

number of timesteps before the amplitude is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE in the manual)

NOTES
  • this is a global setting for all cores
  • internally the time divider is used to calculate the amount of change per event using a given amplitude slope, please set the time divider before setting the amplitude slope
Parameters
  • divider (int): the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during an amplitude ramp

435        -----

438            please set the time divider before setting the amplitude slope
439        
440        Returns
441        ----------
442        divider : int
443            the number of DDS timesteps that a value is kept constant during an amplitude ramp
444        """

446        return self.card.get_i(SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE)

get the number of timesteps before the amplitude is changed during a frequency ramp. (see register SPC_DDS_AMP_RAMP_STEPSIZE in the manual)

def amp(self, core_index: int, amplitude: float) -> None: 
449    def amp(self, core_index : int, amplitude : float) -> None:
450        """
451        set the amplitude of the sine wave of a specific core (see register `SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP` in the manual)
452        
453        Parameters
454        ----------
455        core_index : int
456            the index of the core to be changed
457        amplitude : float
458            the value between 0 and 1 corresponding to the amplitude
459        """
460
461        self.set_d(SPC_DDS_CORE0_AMP + core_index, float(amplitude))

def avail_amp_slope_max(self) -> float: 
801    def avail_amp_slope_max(self) -> float:
802        """

804
805        Returns
806        -------
807        float
808            the maximum available amplitude slope
809        """
810
811        return self.card.get_d(SPC_DDS_AVAIL_AMP_SLOPE_MAX)

def write_to_card(self, flags=0) -> None: 
868    def write_to_card(self, flags=0) -> None:

870        send a list of all the commands that came after the last write_list and send them to the card (see register `SPC_DDS_CMD` in the manual)
871        """

send a list of all the commands that came after the last write_list and send them to the card (see register SPC_DDS_CMD in the manual)

def kwargs2mask(self, kwargs: dict[str, bool], prefix: str = '') -> int: 
876    def kwargs2mask(self, kwargs : dict[str, bool], prefix : str = "") -> int:
877        """
878        DDS helper: transform a dictionary with keys with a specific prefix to a bitmask
879
880        Parameters
881        ----------
882        kwargs : dict
883            dictonary with keys with a specific prefix and values given by bools
884        prefix : str
885            a prefix for the key names
886        
887        Returns
888        -------
889        int
890            bit mask
891        
892        Example
893        -------
894        ['core_0' = True, 'core_2' = False, 'core_3' = True] => 0b1001 = 9
895        """
896        
897        mask = 0
898        for keyword, value in kwargs.items():
899            bit = int(keyword[len(prefix)+1:])
900            if value:
901                mask |= 1 << bit
902            else:
903                mask &= ~(1 << bit)
904        return mask

DDS helper: transform a dictionary with keys with a specific prefix to a bitmask

Parameters
  • kwargs (dict): dictonary with keys with a specific prefix and values given by bools
  • prefix (str): a prefix for the key names
Returns
  • int: bit mask
Example

['core_0' = True, 'core_2' = False, 'core_3' = True] => 0b1001 = 9

def k2m(self, kwargs: dict[str, bool], prefix: str = '') -> int: 
876    def kwargs2mask(self, kwargs : dict[str, bool], prefix : str = "") -> int:
877        """
878        DDS helper: transform a dictionary with keys with a specific prefix to a bitmask
879
880        Parameters
881        ----------
882        kwargs : dict
883            dictonary with keys with a specific prefix and values given by bools
884        prefix : str
885            a prefix for the key names
886        
887        Returns
888        -------
889        int
890            bit mask
891        
892        Example
893        -------
894        ['core_0' = True, 'core_2' = False, 'core_3' = True] => 0b1001 = 9
895        """
896        
897        mask = 0
898        for keyword, value in kwargs.items():
899            bit = int(keyword[len(prefix)+1:])
900            if value:
901                mask |= 1 << bit
902            else:
903                mask &= ~(1 << bit)
904        return mask

DDS helper: transform a dictionary with keys with a specific prefix to a bitmask

Parameters
  • kwargs (dict): dictonary with keys with a specific prefix and values given by bools
  • prefix (str): a prefix for the key names
Returns
  • int: bit mask
Example

['core_0' = True, 'core_2' = False, 'core_3' = True] => 0b1001 = 9

class PulseGenerator: 
 10class PulseGenerator:
 11    """
 12    a class to implement a single pulse generator
 13    
 14    Parameters
 15    ----------
 16    card : Card
 17        the card object that is used by the functionality
 18    pg_index : int
 19        the index of the used pulse generator
 20    """
 21
 22    card : Card
 23    pg_index : int
 24    """The index of the pulse generator"""
 25
 26    _reg_distance : int = 100
 27
 28    def __init__(self, card : Card, pg_index : int, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 29        """
 30        The constructor of the PulseGenerator class
 31
 32        Parameters
 33        ----------
 34        card : Card
 35            the card object that is used by the functionality
 36        pg_index : int
 37            the index of the used pulse generator
 38        """
 39        
 40        self.card = card
 41        self.pg_index = pg_index
 42
 43    def __str__(self) -> str:
 44        """
 45        String representation of the PulseGenerator class
 46    
 47        Returns
 48        -------
 49        str
 50            String representation of the PulseGenerator class
 51        """
 52        
 53        return f"PulseGenerator(card={self.card}, pg_index={self.pg_index})"
 54    
 55    __repr__ = __str__
 56    
 57    # The trigger behavior of the pulse generator
 58    def mode(self, mode : int = None) -> int:
 59        """
 60        Set the trigger mode of the pulse generator (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_MODE' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
 61
 62        Parameters
 63        ----------
 64        mode : int
 65            The trigger mode
 66        
 67        Returns
 68        -------
 69        int
 70            The trigger mode
 71        """
 72
 73        if mode is not None:
 74            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_MODE + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index, mode)
 75        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_MODE + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index)
 76    
 77    # The duration of a single period
 78    def period_length(self, length : int = None) -> int:
 79        """
 80        Set the period length of the pulse generator (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_LEN' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
 81
 82        Parameters
 83        ----------
 84        length : int
 85            The period length in clock cycles
 86        
 87        Returns
 88        -------
 89        int
 90            The period length in clock cycles
 91        """
 92
 93        if length is not None:
 94            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_LEN + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index, length)
 95        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_LEN + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index)
 96

148        if length is not None:
149            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_HIGH + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index, length)
150        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_HIGH + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index)

Set the high length of the pulse generator (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_HIGH' in chapter Pulse Generator in the manual)

Parameters
  • pg_index (int): The index of the pulse generator
  • length (int): The high length in clock cycles
Returns
  • int: The high length in clock cycles

157        -------
158        int
159            The available minimal high length in clock cycles
160        """

def num_loops(self, loops: int = None) -> int: 
186    def num_loops(self, loops : int = None) -> int:

191        ----------

194        
195        Returns
196        -------
197        int
198            The number of loops
199        """

202            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_LOOPS + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index, loops)
203        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN0_LOOPS + self._reg_distance*self.pg_index)

class PulseGenerators(spcm.CardFunctionality): 
349class PulseGenerators(CardFunctionality):
350    """
351    a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement Pulse generator functionality
352
353    Parameters
354    ----------
355    generators : list[PulseGenerator]
356        a list of pulse generators
357    num_generators : int
358        the number of pulse generators on the card
359    """
360    
361    generators : list[PulseGenerator]
362    num_generators = 4
363
364    def __init__(self, card : Card, enable : int | bool = 0, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
365        """
366        The constructor of the PulseGenerators class
367
368        Parameters
369        ----------
370        card : Card
371            the card object that is used by the functionality
372        
373        Raises
374        ------
375        SpcmException
376        """
377
378        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
379        # Check for the pulse generator option on the card
380        features = self.card.get_i(SPC_PCIEXTFEATURES)
381        if features & SPCM_FEAT_EXTFW_PULSEGEN and self.card._verbose:
382            print(f"Pulse generator option available")
383        else:
384            raise SpcmException(text="This card doesn't have the pulse generator functionality installed. Please contact sales@spec.de to get more information about this functionality.")
385        
386        self.load()
387        self.enable(enable)
388    
389    def load(self) -> None:
390        """Load the pulse generators"""
391        self.generators = [PulseGenerator(self.card, i) for i in range(self.num_generators)]
392
393    # TODO in the next driver release there will be a register to get the number of pulse generators
394    def get_num_generators(self) -> int:
395        """
396        Get the number of pulse generators on the card
397
398        Returns
399        -------
400        int
401            The number of pulse generators
402        """
403
404        return self.num_generators
405    
406    def __str__(self) -> str:
407        """
408        String representation of the PulseGenerators class
409    
410        Returns
411        -------
412        str
413            String representation of the PulseGenerators class
414        """
415        
416        return f"PulseGenerators(card={self.card})"
417    
418    __repr__ = __str__
419    
420
421    def __iter__(self) -> "PulseGenerators":
422        """Define this class as an iterator"""
423        return self
424    
425    def __getitem__(self, index : int) -> PulseGenerator:
426        """
427        Get the pulse generator at the given index
428
429        Parameters
430        ----------
431        index : int
432            The index of the pulse generator
433        
434        Returns
435        -------
436        PulseGenerator
437            The pulse generator at the given index
438        """
439
440        return self.generators[index]
441    
442    _generator_iterator_index = -1
443    def __next__(self) -> PulseGenerator:
444        """
445        This method is called when the next element is requested from the iterator
446
447        Returns
448        -------
449        PulseGenerator
450            the next available pulse generator
451        
452        Raises
453        ------
454        StopIteration
455        """
456        self._generator_iterator_index += 1
457        if self._generator_iterator_index >= len(self.channels):
458            self._generator_iterator_index = -1
459            raise StopIteration
460        return self.generators[self._generator_iterator_index]
461    
462    def __len__(self) -> int:
463        """Returns the number of available pulse generators"""
464        return len(self.generators)
465    
466    def write_setup(self) -> None:
467        """Write the setup to the card"""
468        self.card.write_setup()
469
470    # The pulse generator can be enabled or disabled
471    def enable(self, enable : int | bool = None) -> int:
472        """
473        Enable or disable (all) the pulse generators (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
474
475        Parameters
476        ----------
477        enable : int | bool
478            Enable or disable (all) the different pulse generators, by default all are turned off
479        
480        Returns
481        -------
482        int
483            The enable state of the pulse generators
484        """
485
486        
487        if isinstance(enable, bool):
488            enable = (1 << self.num_generators) - 1 if enable else 0
489        if enable is not None:
490            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE, enable)
491        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE)
492    
493    def cmd(self, cmd : int) -> None:
494        """
495        Execute a command on the pulse generator (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_COMMAND' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
496
497        Parameters
498        ----------
499        cmd : int
500            The command to execute
501        """
502        self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_COMMAND, cmd)
503    
504    def force(self) -> None:
505        """
506        Generate a single rising edge, that is common for all pulse generator engines. This allows to start/trigger the output 
507        of all enabled pulse generators synchronously by issuing a software command. (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_COMMAND' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
508        """
509        self.cmd(SPCM_PULSEGEN_CMD_FORCE)
510    
511    def write_setup(self) -> None:
512        """Write the setup of the pulse generator to the card"""
513        self.card.write_setup()
514    
515    # The clock rate in Hz of the pulse generator
516    def get_clock(self) -> int:
517        """
518        Get the clock rate of the pulse generator (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_CLOCK' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
519
520        Returns
521        -------
522        int
523            The clock rate in Hz
524        """
525        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_CLOCK)

a higher-level abstraction of the CardFunctionality class to implement Pulse generator functionality

Parameters
  • generators (list[PulseGenerator]): a list of pulse generators
  • num_generators (int): the number of pulse generators on the card
PulseGenerators( card: Card, enable: int | bool = 0, *args, **kwargs)

371            the card object that is used by the functionality
372

374        ------
375        SpcmException
376        """

379        # Check for the pulse generator option on the card
380        features = self.card.get_i(SPC_PCIEXTFEATURES)
381        if features & SPCM_FEAT_EXTFW_PULSEGEN and self.card._verbose:
382            print(f"Pulse generator option available")
383        else:
384            raise SpcmException(text="This card doesn't have the pulse generator functionality installed. Please contact sales@spec.de to get more information about this functionality.")
385

387        self.enable(enable)

512        """Write the setup of the pulse generator to the card"""
513        self.card.write_setup()

Write the setup of the pulse generator to the card

def enable(self, enable: int | bool = None) -> int: 
471    def enable(self, enable : int | bool = None) -> int:
472        """
473        Enable or disable (all) the pulse generators (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
474
475        Parameters
476        ----------
477        enable : int | bool
478            Enable or disable (all) the different pulse generators, by default all are turned off
479        
480        Returns
481        -------
482        int
483            The enable state of the pulse generators
484        """
485
486        
487        if isinstance(enable, bool):
488            enable = (1 << self.num_generators) - 1 if enable else 0
489        if enable is not None:
490            self.card.set_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE, enable)
491        return self.card.get_i(SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE)

Enable or disable (all) the pulse generators (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_ENABLE' in chapter Pulse Generator in the manual)

def cmd(self, cmd: int) -> None:

def force(self) -> None:

505        """
506        Generate a single rising edge, that is common for all pulse generator engines. This allows to start/trigger the output 
507        of all enabled pulse generators synchronously by issuing a software command. (see register 'SPC_XIO_PULSEGEN_COMMAND' in chapter `Pulse Generator` in the manual)
508        """
509        self.cmd(SPCM_PULSEGEN_CMD_FORCE)

Inherited Members

card
function_type
class Multi(spcm.DataTransfer): 
 12class Multi(DataTransfer):
 13    """a high-level class to control Multiple Recording and Replay functionality on Spectrum Instrumentation cards
 14
 15    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 16    for your specific card.
 17
 18    """
 19
 20    # Private
 21    _segment_size : int = 0
 22
 23    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 24        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
 25
 26    def segment_samples(self, segment_size : int) -> None:
 27        """
 28        Sets the memory size in samples per channel. The memory size setting must be set before transferring 
 29        data to the card. (see register `SPC_MEMSIZE` in the manual)
 30        
 31        Parameters
 32        ----------
 33        segment_size : int
 34            the size of a single segment in memory in Bytes
 35        """
 36        self.card.set_i(SPC_SEGMENTSIZE, segment_size)
 37        self._segment_size = segment_size
 38    
 39    def allocate_buffer(self, segment_samples : int, num_segments : int) -> None:
 40        """Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card
 41
 42        Parameters
 43        ----------
 44        num_samples_per_segment : int = None
 45            use the number of samples and get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
 46        num_segments : int
 47            the number of segments that are used for the multiple recording mode
 48        """
 49        
 50        self.segment_samples(segment_samples)
 51        super().allocate_buffer(segment_samples * num_segments)
 52        num_channels = self.card.active_channels()
 53        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
 54            self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((num_channels, num_segments, segment_samples), order='C')
 55    
 56    
 57    
 58    def __next__(self) -> npt.ArrayLike:
 59        """
 60        This method is called when the next element is requested from the iterator
 61
 62        Returns
 63        -------
 64        npt.ArrayLike
 65            the next data block
 66        
 67        Raises
 68        ------
 69        StopIteration
 70        """
 71        timeout_counter = 0
 72        # notify the card that data is available or read, but only after the first block
 73        if self._current_samples >= self._notify_samples:
 74            self.avail_card_len(self._notify_samples)
 75        while True:
 76            try:
 77                self.wait_dma()
 78            except SpcmTimeout:
 79                self.card._print("... Timeout ({})".format(timeout_counter), end='\r')
 80                timeout_counter += 1
 81                if timeout_counter > self._max_timeout:
 82                    raise StopIteration
 83            else:
 84                user_len = self.avail_user_len()
 85                user_pos = self.avail_user_pos()
 86
 87                current_segment = user_pos // self._segment_size
 88                current_pos_in_segment = user_pos % self._segment_size
 89                final_segment = (user_pos+user_len) // self._segment_size
 90                final_pos_in_segment = (user_pos+user_len) % self._segment_size
 91
 92                print("NumSamples = {}, CurrentSegment = {}, CurrentPos = {},  FinalSegment = {}, FinalPos = {}, UserLen = {}".format(self._notify_samples, current_segment, current_pos_in_segment, final_segment, final_pos_in_segment, user_len))
 93
 94                self._current_samples += self._notify_samples
 95                if self._to_transfer_samples != 0 and self._to_transfer_samples < self._current_samples:
 96                    raise StopIteration
 97
 98                fill_size = self.fill_size_promille()
 99                self.card._print("Fill size: {}%  Pos:{:08x} Len:{:08x} Total:{:.2f} MiS / {:.2f} MiS".format(fill_size/10, user_pos, user_len, self._current_samples / MEBI(1), self._to_transfer_samples / MEBI(1)), end='\r')
100
101                return self.buffer[:, current_segment:final_segment, :]

a high-level class to control Multiple Recording and Replay functionality on Spectrum Instrumentation cards

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card.

Multi(card, *args, **kwargs) 
23    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
24        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)

Initialize the DataTransfer object with a card object and additional arguments

Parameters
  • card (Card): the card object that is used for the data transfer
  • *args (list): list of additional arguments
  • **kwargs (dict): dictionary of additional keyword arguments
def segment_samples(self, segment_size: int) -> None: 
26    def segment_samples(self, segment_size : int) -> None:
27        """
28        Sets the memory size in samples per channel. The memory size setting must be set before transferring 
29        data to the card. (see register `SPC_MEMSIZE` in the manual)
30        
31        Parameters
32        ----------
33        segment_size : int
34            the size of a single segment in memory in Bytes
35        """
36        self.card.set_i(SPC_SEGMENTSIZE, segment_size)
37        self._segment_size = segment_size

Sets the memory size in samples per channel. The memory size setting must be set before transferring data to the card. (see register SPC_MEMSIZE in the manual)

Parameters
  • segment_size (int): the size of a single segment in memory in Bytes
def allocate_buffer(self, segment_samples: int, num_segments: int) -> None: 
39    def allocate_buffer(self, segment_samples : int, num_segments : int) -> None:
40        """Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card
41
42        Parameters
43        ----------
44        num_samples_per_segment : int = None
45            use the number of samples and get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
46        num_segments : int
47            the number of segments that are used for the multiple recording mode
48        """
49        
50        self.segment_samples(segment_samples)
51        super().allocate_buffer(segment_samples * num_segments)
52        num_channels = self.card.active_channels()
53        if self.bits_per_sample > 1:
54            self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((num_channels, num_segments, segment_samples), order='C')

Memory allocation for the buffer that is used for communicating with the card

Parameters
  • num_samples_per_segment (int = None): use the number of samples and get the number of active channels and bytes per samples directly from the card
  • num_segments (int): the number of segments that are used for the multiple recording mode

class TimeStamp(spcm.DataTransfer): 
 13class TimeStamp(DataTransfer):
 14    """a class to control Spectrum Instrumentation cards with the timestamp functionality
 15
 16    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 17    for your specific card
 18
 19    Parameters
 20    ----------
 21    ts_mode : int
 22    transfer_mode : int
 23    bits_per_ts : int = 0
 24    bytes_per_ts : int = 16
 25    """
 26    ts_mode : int
 27    transfer_mode : int
 28
 29    bits_per_ts : int = 0
 30    bytes_per_ts : int = 16
 31    
 32    _notify_timestamps : int = 0
 33    _to_transfer_timestamps : int = 0
 34
 35    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 36        """
 37        Initialize the TimeStamp object with a card object
 38
 39        Parameters
 40        ----------
 41        card : Card
 42            a card object that is used to control the card
 43        """
 44        
 45        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
 46        self.buffer_type = SPCM_BUF_TIMESTAMP
 47        self.bits_per_ts = self.bytes_per_ts * 8
 48    
 49    def cmd(self, *args) -> None:
 50        """
 51        Execute spcm timestamp commands (see register 'SPC_TIMESTAMP_CMD' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)
 52    
 53        Parameters
 54        ----------
 55        *args : int
 56            The different timestamp command flags to be executed.
 57        """
 58
 59        cmd = 0
 60        for arg in args:
 61            cmd |= arg
 62        self.card.set_i(SPC_TIMESTAMP_CMD, cmd)
 63    
 64    def reset(self) -> None:
 65        """Reset the timestamp counter (see command 'SPC_TS_RESET' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)"""
 66        self.cmd(SPC_TS_RESET)
 67    
 68    def mode(self, mode : int, *args : list[int]) -> None:
 69        """
 70        Set the mode of the timestamp counter (see register 'SPC_TIMESTAMP_CMD' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)
 71
 72        Parameters
 73        ----------
 74        mode : int
 75            The mode of the timestamp counter
 76        *args : list[int]
 77            List of additional commands send with setting the mode
 78        """
 79        self.ts_mode = mode
 80        self.cmd(self.ts_mode, *args)
 81
 82    def notify_timestamps(self, notify_timestamps : int) -> None:
 83        """
 84        Set the number of timestamps to notify the user about
 85        
 86        Parameters
 87        ----------
 88        notify_timestamps : int
 89            the number of timestamps to notify the user about
 90        """
 91        self._notify_timestamps = notify_timestamps
 92    
 93    def allocate_buffer(self, num_timestamps : int) -> None:
 94        """
 95        Allocate the buffer for the timestamp data transfer
 96        
 97        Parameters
 98        ----------
 99        num_timestamps : int
100            The number of timestamps to be allocated
101        """
102
103        self.buffer_size = num_timestamps * self.bytes_per_ts
104
105        dwMask = self._buffer_alignment - 1
106
107        sample_type = np.int64
108        item_size = sample_type(0).itemsize
109        # allocate a buffer (numpy array) for DMA transfer: a little bigger one to have room for address alignment
110        databuffer_unaligned = np.empty(((self._buffer_alignment + self.buffer_size) // item_size, ), dtype = sample_type)   # half byte count at int16 sample (// = integer division)
111        # two numpy-arrays may share the same memory: skip the begin up to the alignment boundary (ArrayVariable[SKIP_VALUE:])
112        # Address of data-memory from numpy-array: ArrayVariable.__array_interface__['data'][0]
113        start_pos_samples = ((self._buffer_alignment - (databuffer_unaligned.__array_interface__['data'][0] & dwMask)) // item_size)
114        self.buffer = databuffer_unaligned[start_pos_samples:start_pos_samples + (self.buffer_size // item_size)]   # byte address but int16 sample: therefore / 2
115        self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((num_timestamps, 2), order='C') # array items per timestamp, because the maximum item size is 8 bytes = 64 bits
116    
117    def start_buffer_transfer(self, *args, direction=SPCM_DIR_CARDTOPC, notify_samples=0, transfer_offset=0, transfer_length=None) -> None:
118        """
119        Start the transfer of the timestamp data to the card
120        
121        Parameters
122        ----------
123        *args : list
124            list of additonal arguments that are added as flags to the start dma command
125        """
126        
127        notify_size = 0
128        if notify_samples: 
129            self._notify_timestamps = notify_samples
130        if self._notify_timestamps: 
131            notify_size = self._notify_timestamps * self.bytes_per_ts
132
133        if transfer_offset:
134            transfer_offset_bytes = transfer_offset * self.bytes_per_ts
135        else:
136            transfer_offset_bytes = 0
137
138        if transfer_length is not None: 
139            transfer_length_bytes = transfer_length * self.bytes_per_ts
140        else:
141            transfer_length_bytes = self.buffer_size
142
143
144        # we define the buffer for transfer and start the DMA transfer
145        self.card._print("Starting the Timestamp transfer and waiting until data is in board memory")
146        self._c_buffer = self.buffer.ctypes.data_as(c_void_p)
147        spcm_dwDefTransfer_i64(self.card._handle, self.buffer_type, direction, notify_size, self._c_buffer, transfer_offset_bytes, transfer_length_bytes)
148        cmd = 0
149        for arg in args:
150            cmd |= arg
151        self.card.cmd(cmd)
152        self.card._print("... timestamp data transfer started")
153    
154    def avail_card_len(self, num_timestamps : int) -> None:
155        """
156        Set the amount of timestamps that is available for reading of the timestamp buffer (see register 'SPC_TS_AVAIL_CARD_LEN' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)
157
158        Parameters
159        ----------
160        num_timestamps : int
161            the amount of timestamps that is available for reading
162        """
163        card_len = num_timestamps * self.bytes_per_ts
164        self.card.set_i(SPC_TS_AVAIL_CARD_LEN, card_len)
165    
166    def avail_user_pos(self) -> int:
167        """
168        Get the current position of the pointer in the timestamp buffer (see register 'SPC_TS_AVAIL_USER_POS' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)
169
170        Returns
171        -------
172        int
173            pointer position in timestamps
174        """
175        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TS_AVAIL_USER_POS) // self.bytes_per_ts
176    
177    def avail_user_len(self) -> int:
178        """
179        Get the current length of the data in timestamps in the timestamp buffer (see register 'SPC_TS_AVAIL_USER_LEN' in chapter `Timestamp` in the manual)
180
181        Returns
182        -------
183        int
184            data length available in number of timestamps
185        """
186        return self.card.get_i(SPC_TS_AVAIL_USER_LEN) // self.bytes_per_ts
187    
188
189    # Iterator methods
190    _max_polling = 64
191
192    def to_transfer_timestamps(self, timestamps: int) -> None:
193        """
194        This method sets the number of timestamps to transfer
195
196        Parameters
197        ----------
198        timestamps : int
199            the number of timestamps to transfer
200        """
201        self._to_transfer_timestamps = timestamps
202
203    def poll(self) -> npt.ArrayLike:
204        """
205        This method is called when polling for timestamps
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        npt.ArrayLike
210            the next data block
211        """
212        while True:
213            user_len = self.avail_user_len()
214            if user_len >= 1:
215                user_pos = self.avail_user_pos()
216                self.avail_card_len(user_len)
217                return self.buffer[user_pos:user_pos+user_len, :]

a class to control Spectrum Instrumentation cards with the timestamp functionality

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card

Parameters

  • ts_mode (int):

  • transfer_mode (int):

  • bits_per_ts (int = 0):

  • bytes_per_ts (int = 16):

43        """

62        self.card.set_i(SPC_TIMESTAMP_CMD, cmd)
