def allocate_buffer(self, num_timestamps: int) -> None: 
 93    def allocate_buffer(self, num_timestamps : int) -> None:
 94        """
 95        Allocate the buffer for the timestamp data transfer
 96        
 97        Parameters
 98        ----------
 99        num_timestamps : int
100            The number of timestamps to be allocated
101        """
102
103        self.buffer_size = num_timestamps * self.bytes_per_ts
104
105        dwMask = self._buffer_alignment - 1
106
107        sample_type = np.int64
108        item_size = sample_type(0).itemsize
109        # allocate a buffer (numpy array) for DMA transfer: a little bigger one to have room for address alignment
110        databuffer_unaligned = np.empty(((self._buffer_alignment + self.buffer_size) // item_size, ), dtype = sample_type)   # half byte count at int16 sample (// = integer division)
111        # two numpy-arrays may share the same memory: skip the begin up to the alignment boundary (ArrayVariable[SKIP_VALUE:])
112        # Address of data-memory from numpy-array: ArrayVariable.__array_interface__['data'][0]
113        start_pos_samples = ((self._buffer_alignment - (databuffer_unaligned.__array_interface__['data'][0] & dwMask)) // item_size)
114        self.buffer = databuffer_unaligned[start_pos_samples:start_pos_samples + (self.buffer_size // item_size)]   # byte address but int16 sample: therefore / 2
115        self.buffer = self.buffer.reshape((num_timestamps, 2), order='C') # array items per timestamp, because the maximum item size is 8 bytes = 64 bits

def poll( self) -> Union[numpy._typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype[Any]], numpy._typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[numpy._typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype[Any]]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy._typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]]: 
203    def poll(self) -> npt.ArrayLike:
204        """
205        This method is called when polling for timestamps
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        npt.ArrayLike
210            the next data block
211        """
212        while True:
213            user_len = self.avail_user_len()
214            if user_len >= 1:
215                user_pos = self.avail_user_pos()
216                self.avail_card_len(user_len)
217                return self.buffer[user_pos:user_pos+user_len, :]

class Sequence(spcm.DataTransfer): 
  8class Sequence(DataTransfer):
  9    """
 10    a high-level class to control the sequence mode on Spectrum Instrumentation cards
 11
 12    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
 13    for your specific card.
 14
 15    """
 16
 17    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
 18        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
 19
 20    def max_segments(self, max_segments : int = 0) -> int:
 21        """
 22        Set the maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
 23
 24        Parameters
 25        ----------
 26        max_segments : int
 27            The maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode
 28
 29        Returns
 30        -------
 31        max_segments : int
 32            The actual maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode
 33        """
 34        if max_segments: 
 35            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS, max_segments)
 36        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS)
 37    
 38    def write_segment(self, segment : int = None) -> int:
 39        """
 40        Defines the current segment to be addressed by the user. Must be programmed prior to changing any segment parameters. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_WRITESEGMENT' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
 41
 42        Parameters
 43        ----------
 44        segment : int
 45            The segment to be addresses
 46
 47        Returns
 48        -------
 49        segment : int
 50            The segment to be addresses
 51        """
 52
 53        if segment is not None:
 54            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_WRITESEGMENT, segment)
 55        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_WRITESEGMENT)
 56    
 57    def segment_size(self, segment_size : int = None) -> int:
 58        """
 59        Defines the number of valid/to be replayed samples for the current selected memory segment in samples per channel. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
 60
 61        Parameters
 62        ----------
 63        segment_size : int
 64            The size of the segment in samples
 65
 66        Returns
 67        -------
 68        segment_size : int
 69            The size of the segment in samples
 70        """
 71
 72        if segment_size is not None:
 73            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE, segment_size)
 74        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE)
 75    
 76    def step_memory(self, step_index : int, next_step_index : int = None, segment_index : int = None, loops : int = None, flags : int = None) -> tuple[int, int, int, int]:
 77        """
 78        Defines the step memory for the current selected memory segment. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
 79
 80        Parameters
 81        ----------
 82        step_index : int
 83            The index of the current step
 84        next_step_index : int
 85            The index of the next step in the sequence
 86        segment_index : int
 87            The index of the segment associated to the step
 88        loops : int
 89            The number of times the segment is looped 
 90        flags : int
 91            The flags for the step
 92
 93        Returns
 94        -------
 95        next_step_index : int
 96            The index of the next step in the sequence
 97        segment_index : int
 98            The index of the segment associated to the step
 99        loops : int
100            The number of times the segment is looped 
101        flags : int
102            The flags for the step
103
104        """
105        qwSequenceEntry = 0
106
107        # setup register value
108        if next_step_index is not None and segment_index is not None and loops is not None and flags is not None:
109            qwSequenceEntry = (flags & ~SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK) | (loops & SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK)
110            qwSequenceEntry <<= 32
111            qwSequenceEntry |= ((next_step_index << 16) & SPCSEQ_NEXTSTEPMASK) | (int(segment_index) & SPCSEQ_SEGMENTMASK)
112            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0 + step_index, qwSequenceEntry)
113        
114        qwSequenceEntry = self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0 + step_index)
115        return (qwSequenceEntry & SPCSEQ_NEXTSTEPMASK) >> 16, qwSequenceEntry & SPCSEQ_SEGMENTMASK, (qwSequenceEntry >> 32) & SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK, (qwSequenceEntry >> 32) & ~SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK
116
117    
118    def start_step(self, start_step_index : int = None) -> int:
119        """
120        Defines which of all defined steps in the sequence memory will be used first directly after the card start. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
121
122        Parameters
123        ----------
124        start_step_index : int
125            The index of the start step
126
127        Returns
128        -------
129        start_step_index : int
130            The index of the start step
131        """
132
133        if start_step_index is not None:
134            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP, start_step_index)
135        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP)
136    
137    def status(self) -> int:
138        """
139        Reads the status of the sequence mode. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STATUS' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
140
141        Returns
142        -------
143        status : int
144            The status of the sequence mode
145
146        """
147        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STATUS)

a high-level class to control the sequence mode on Spectrum Instrumentation cards

For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual for your specific card.

Sequence(card, *args, **kwargs) 
17    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
18        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)

Parameters

  • *args (list): list of additional arguments
  • **kwargs (dict): dictionary of additional keyword arguments
def max_segments(self, max_segments: int = 0) -> int: 
20    def max_segments(self, max_segments : int = 0) -> int:
21        """
22        Set the maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
23
24        Parameters
25        ----------
26        max_segments : int
27            The maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode
28
29        Returns
30        -------
31        max_segments : int
32            The actual maximum number of segments that can be used in the sequence mode
33        """
34        if max_segments: 
35            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS, max_segments)
36        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_MAXSEGMENTS)

def segment_size(self, segment_size: int = None) -> int: 
57    def segment_size(self, segment_size : int = None) -> int:
58        """
59        Defines the number of valid/to be replayed samples for the current selected memory segment in samples per channel. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
60
61        Parameters
62        ----------
63        segment_size : int
64            The size of the segment in samples
65
66        Returns
67        -------
68        segment_size : int
69            The size of the segment in samples
70        """
71
72        if segment_size is not None:
73            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE, segment_size)
74        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE)

Defines the number of valid/to be replayed samples for the current selected memory segment in samples per channel. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_SEGMENTSIZE' in chapter Sequence Mode in the manual)

Parameters
  • segment_size (int): The size of the segment in samples
Returns
  • segment_size (int): The size of the segment in samples
def step_memory( self, step_index: int, next_step_index: int = None, segment_index: int = None, loops: int = None, flags: int = None) -> tuple[int, int, int, int]: 
 76    def step_memory(self, step_index : int, next_step_index : int = None, segment_index : int = None, loops : int = None, flags : int = None) -> tuple[int, int, int, int]:
 77        """
 78        Defines the step memory for the current selected memory segment. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
 79
 80        Parameters
 81        ----------
 82        step_index : int
 83            The index of the current step
 84        next_step_index : int
 85            The index of the next step in the sequence
 86        segment_index : int
 87            The index of the segment associated to the step
 88        loops : int
 89            The number of times the segment is looped 
 90        flags : int
 91            The flags for the step
 92
 93        Returns
 94        -------
 95        next_step_index : int
 96            The index of the next step in the sequence
 97        segment_index : int
 98            The index of the segment associated to the step
 99        loops : int
100            The number of times the segment is looped 
101        flags : int
102            The flags for the step
103
104        """
105        qwSequenceEntry = 0
106
107        # setup register value
108        if next_step_index is not None and segment_index is not None and loops is not None and flags is not None:
109            qwSequenceEntry = (flags & ~SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK) | (loops & SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK)
110            qwSequenceEntry <<= 32
111            qwSequenceEntry |= ((next_step_index << 16) & SPCSEQ_NEXTSTEPMASK) | (int(segment_index) & SPCSEQ_SEGMENTMASK)
112            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0 + step_index, qwSequenceEntry)
113        
114        qwSequenceEntry = self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0 + step_index)
115        return (qwSequenceEntry & SPCSEQ_NEXTSTEPMASK) >> 16, qwSequenceEntry & SPCSEQ_SEGMENTMASK, (qwSequenceEntry >> 32) & SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK, (qwSequenceEntry >> 32) & ~SPCSEQ_LOOPMASK

Defines the step memory for the current selected memory segment. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STEPMEM0' in chapter Sequence Mode in the manual)

Parameters
  • step_index (int): The index of the current step
  • next_step_index (int): The index of the next step in the sequence
  • segment_index (int): The index of the segment associated to the step
  • loops (int): The number of times the segment is looped
  • flags (int): The flags for the step
Returns
  • next_step_index (int): The index of the next step in the sequence
  • segment_index (int): The index of the segment associated to the step
  • loops (int): The number of times the segment is looped
  • flags (int): The flags for the step
def start_step(self, start_step_index: int = None) -> int: 
118    def start_step(self, start_step_index : int = None) -> int:
119        """
120        Defines which of all defined steps in the sequence memory will be used first directly after the card start. (see register 'SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP' in chapter `Sequence Mode` in the manual)
121
122        Parameters
123        ----------
124        start_step_index : int
125            The index of the start step
126
127        Returns
128        -------
129        start_step_index : int
130            The index of the start step
131        """

133        if start_step_index is not None:
134            self.card.set_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP, start_step_index)
135        return self.card.get_i(SPC_SEQMODE_STARTSTEP)

class BlockAverage(spcm.Multi): 
11class BlockAverage(Multi):
12    """a high-level class to control Block Average functionality on Spectrum Instrumentation cards
13
14    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
15    for your specific card.
16
17    """
18
19    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
20        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
21    
22    def averages(self, num_averages : int = None) -> int:
23        """Sets the number of averages for the block averaging functionality (see hardware reference manual register 'SPC_AVERAGES')
24
25        Parameters
26        ----------
27        num_averages : int
28            the number of averages for the boxcar functionality
29
30        Returns
31        -------
32        int
33            the number of averages for the block averaging functionality
34        """
35        if num_averages is not None:
36            self.card.set_i(SPC_AVERAGES, num_averages)
37        return self.card.get_i(SPC_AVERAGES)
38    
39    def bits_per_sample(self) -> int:
40        """
41        Get the number of bits per sample
42
43        Returns
44        -------
45        int
46            number of bits per sample
47        """
48        return super().bits_per_sample * 2
49    
50    def bytes_per_sample(self) -> int:
51        """
52        Get the number of bytes per sample
53
54        Returns
55        -------
56        int
57            number of bytes per sample
58        """
59        return super().bytes_per_sample * 2
60
61    def numpy_type(self) -> npt.NDArray[np.int_]:
62        """
63        Get the type of numpy data from number of bytes
64
65        Returns
66        -------
67        numpy data type
68            the type of data that is used by the card
69        """
70        if self.bytes_per_sample == 2:
71            return np.int16
72        return np.int32

class Boxcar(spcm.Multi): 
11class Boxcar(Multi):
12    """a high-level class to control Boxcar functionality on Spectrum Instrumentation cards
13
14    For more information about what setups are available, please have a look at the user manual
15    for your specific card.
16
17    """
18
19    def __init__(self, card, *args, **kwargs) -> None:
20        super().__init__(card, *args, **kwargs)
21    
22    def box_averages(self, num_averages : int = None) -> int:
23        """Sets the number of averages for the boxcar functionality (see hardware reference manual register 'SPC_BOX_AVERAGES')
24
25        Parameters
26        ----------
27        num_averages : int
28            the number of averages for the boxcar functionality
29
30        Returns
31        -------
32        int
33            the number of averages for the boxcar functionality
34        """
35        if num_averages is not None:
36            self.card.set_i(SPC_BOX_AVERAGES, num_averages)
37        return self.card.get_i(SPC_BOX_AVERAGES)
38    
39    def bits_per_sample(self) -> int:
40        """
41        Get the number of bits per sample
42
43        Returns
44        -------
45        int
46            number of bits per sample
47        """
48        return 32
49    
50    def bytes_per_sample(self) -> int:
51        """
52        Get the number of bytes per sample
53
54        Returns
55        -------
56        int
57            number of bytes per sample
58        """
59        return 4
60
61    def numpy_type(self) -> npt.NDArray[np.int_]:
62        """
63        Get the type of numpy data from number of bytes
64
65        Returns
66        -------
67        numpy data type
68            the type of data that is used by the card
69        """
70        return np.int32

class SpcmException(builtins.Exception): 
101class SpcmException(Exception):
102    """a container class for handling driver level errors
103
104    Examples
105    ----------
106    ```python
107    raise SpcmException(handle=card.handle())
108    raise SpcmException(register=0, value=0, text="Some weird error")
109    ```
110    
111    Parameters
112    ---------
113    error : SpcmError
114        the error that induced the raising of the exception
115    
116    """
117    error = None
118
119    def __init__(self, error = None, register = None, value = None, text = None) -> None:
120        """
121        Constructs exception object and an associated error object, either by getting 
122        the last error from the card specified by the handle or using the information 
123        coming from the parameters register, value and text
124
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        handle : drv_handle (optional)
128            a card handle to obtain the last error
129        register, value and text : int, int, str (optional)
130            parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
131        """
132        if error: self.error = error
133        if register or value or text:
134            self.error = SpcmError(register=register, value=value, text=text)
135        
136    
137    def __str__(self) -> str:
138        """
139        Returns a human-readable text of the last error connected to the exception
140    
141        Class Parameters
142        ----------
143        self.error
144    
145        Returns
146        -------
147        str
148            the human-readable text as return by the error
149        """
150        
151        return str(self.error)

a container class for handling driver level errors

Examples
raise SpcmException(handle=card.handle())
raise SpcmException(register=0, value=0, text="Some weird error")
Parameters
  • error (SpcmError): the error that induced the raising of the exception
SpcmException(error=None, register=None, value=None, text=None) 
119    def __init__(self, error = None, register = None, value = None, text = None) -> None:
120        """
121        Constructs exception object and an associated error object, either by getting 
122        the last error from the card specified by the handle or using the information 
123        coming from the parameters register, value and text
124
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        handle : drv_handle (optional)
128            a card handle to obtain the last error
129        register, value and text : int, int, str (optional)
130            parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
131        """
132        if error: self.error = error
133        if register or value or text:
134            self.error = SpcmError(register=register, value=value, text=text)

Constructs exception object and an associated error object, either by getting the last error from the card specified by the handle or using the information coming from the parameters register, value and text

Parameters
  • handle (drv_handle (optional)): a card handle to obtain the last error
  • register, value and text (int, int, str (optional)): parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
error = None

Inherited Members
builtins.Exception

add_note
args
class SpcmError: 
11class SpcmError():
12    """a container class for handling driver level errors
13        
14    Examples
15    ----------
16    ```python
17    error = SpcmError(handle=card.handle())
18    error = SpcmError(register=0, value=0, text="Some weird error")
19    ```
20
21    Parameters
22    ---------
23    register : int
24        the register address that triggered the error
25    
26    value : int
27        the value that was written to the register address
28    
29    text : str
30        the human-readable text associated with the error
31    
32    """
33
34    register : int = 0
35    value : int = 0
36    text : str = ""
37    _handle = None
38    
39    def __init__(self, handle = None, register = None, value = None, text = None) -> None:
40        """
41        Constructs an error object, either by getting the last error from the card specified by the handle
42        or using the information coming from the parameters register, value and text
43
44        Parameters
45        ----------
46        handle : pyspcm.drv_handle (optional)
47            a card handle to obtain the last error
48        register, value and text : int, int, str (optional)
49            parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
50        """
51        if handle:
52            self._handle = handle
53            self.get_info()
54        if register: self.register = register
55        if value: self.value = value
56        if text: self.text = text
57
58    def get_info(self) -> int:
59        """
60        Gets the last error registered by the card and puts it in the object
61    
62        Class Parameters
63        ----------
64        self.register
65        self.value
66        self.text
67    
68        Returns
69        -------
70        int
71            Error number of the spcm_dwGetErrorInfo_i32 class
72        """
73
74        register = uint32(0)
75        value = int32(0)
76        text = create_string_buffer(ERRORTEXTLEN)
77        dwErr = spcm_dwGetErrorInfo_i32(self._handle, byref(register), byref(value), byref(text))
78        self.register = register.value
79        self.value = value.value
80        self.text = text.value.decode('utf-8')
81        return dwErr
82    
83    def __str__(self) -> str:
84        """
85        Returns a human-readable text of the last error
86    
87        Class Parameters
88        ----------
89        self.register
90        self.value
91        self.text
92    
93        Returns
94        -------
95        str
96            the human-readable text as saved in self.text.
97        """
98        
99        return str(self.text)

a container class for handling driver level errors

Examples
error = SpcmError(handle=card.handle())
error = SpcmError(register=0, value=0, text="Some weird error")
Parameters
  • register (int): the register address that triggered the error
  • value (int): the value that was written to the register address
  • text (str): the human-readable text associated with the error
SpcmError(handle=None, register=None, value=None, text=None) 
39    def __init__(self, handle = None, register = None, value = None, text = None) -> None:
40        """
41        Constructs an error object, either by getting the last error from the card specified by the handle
42        or using the information coming from the parameters register, value and text
43
44        Parameters
45        ----------
46        handle : pyspcm.drv_handle (optional)
47            a card handle to obtain the last error
48        register, value and text : int, int, str (optional)
49            parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
50        """
51        if handle:
52            self._handle = handle
53            self.get_info()
54        if register: self.register = register
55        if value: self.value = value
56        if text: self.text = text

Constructs an error object, either by getting the last error from the card specified by the handle or using the information coming from the parameters register, value and text

Parameters
  • handle (pyspcm.drv_handle (optional)): a card handle to obtain the last error
  • register, value and text (int, int, str (optional)): parameters to define an error that is not raised by a driver error
register: int = 0
value: int = 0
text: str = ''
def get_info(self) -> int: 
58    def get_info(self) -> int:
59        """
60        Gets the last error registered by the card and puts it in the object
61    
62        Class Parameters
63        ----------
64        self.register
65        self.value
66        self.text
67    
68        Returns
69        -------
70        int
71            Error number of the spcm_dwGetErrorInfo_i32 class
72        """
73
74        register = uint32(0)
75        value = int32(0)
76        text = create_string_buffer(ERRORTEXTLEN)
77        dwErr = spcm_dwGetErrorInfo_i32(self._handle, byref(register), byref(value), byref(text))
78        self.register = register.value
79        self.value = value.value
80        self.text = text.value.decode('utf-8')
81        return dwErr

Gets the last error registered by the card and puts it in the object

Class Parameters

self.register self.value self.text

Returns
  • int: Error number of the spcm_dwGetErrorInfo_i32 class
